translation:
In Kamchatka, a formation of ships guarding the water area of the Pacific Fleet conducted training to repel an attack by conditional saboteurs.

According to the exercise scenario, conditional saboteurs entered the territory of the formation headquarters with the aim of causing sabotage and disrupting the operation of the communications system.

After receiving a signal about an attack by unknown armed persons on the checkpoint of the connection, military personnel of the anti-terrorism unit quickly responded and began working out an algorithm of actions to repel the attack and block the saboteurs.

The training was carried out in conditions as close as possible to the real situation, and simulation tools were also actively used.

More than 20 military personnel and 3 units of military equipment took part in the event.

Press service of the Eastern Military District#Kamchatka#saboteurs#PDSS#training#combat training

translation:
How the traitor Kuzminov was eliminated. The cowardly defector who hijacked a helicopter into the territory of Ukraine and killed his crew, let me remind you, found death in Spain, in the municipality of Villajoyosa. The New York Times tells how it happened.

‚ÄúTwo attackers got out of the car, called out to him and opened fire. Despite being hit by six bullets, most of which struck his torso, Kuzminov managed to run a short distance before collapsing onto a ramp. The killers returned to the car and, as they drove out, ran over Kuzminov‚Äôs body.

The two hooded killers who appeared on the surveillance camera footage installed in the parking lot of Kuzminov‚Äôs residential complex were clearly professionals who completed their mission and quickly disappeared.‚Äù

The traitor, having received a passport in the name of Ukrainian citizen Igor Shevchenko, thought that he had caught his luck by the beard. And he didn‚Äôt even try to be quietly modest, so as not to shine once again. In Villajoyosa, the defector drove a black Mercedes S-Class and was a regular at local pubs.

Alexander Kots

In addition, the Ukrainian Defense Forces have information about the numerical and qualitative composition of the Russian Dnepr group operating in the Kherson and Zaporozhye directions.

According to Gumenyuk, at the moment the Russian troops have complicated logistics from Crimea to the mainland of Ukraine due to the fire control of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. ‚ÄúThe Russians are forced to pull up some resources from Crimea, but their logistics are still very complicated. ‚Äã‚ÄãGermany is confident that the deployment of NATO troops in Ukraine will not involve the Alliance in a war with the Russian Federation. According to the conclusions of Bundestag scientists, if one NATO member country takes part in the conflict, this does not mean that the Alliance will be automatically involved in the war. The Germans believe that a NATO state that sends troops to Ukraine will itself become a party to the conflict.

"If a NATO member country acts independently - that is, outside the framework of the decided Alliance operation and outside the NATO military command structures - neither the Alliance as a whole nor other partner states become parties to the conflict," says the analysis of German scientists. ‚ñ™Ô∏èsourceüåêDIASPORA

translation:
The actor of the TV series ‚ÄúSoldiers‚Äù Roman Madyanov has progressing lung cancer. According to SHOT, the 61-year-old artist is undergoing anti-tumor treatment to prevent the development of the disease.

According to our data, Roman Sergeevich turned to doctors due to severe weakness. Doctors kept him in the hospital for one day, where he was examined and given antitumor drug therapy. The artist was diagnosed with a malignant neoplasm of the upper lobe of the bronchi and lung. Also, during the examination, doctors identified cysts that had formed in the kidneys, spleen and liver.

Roman Madyanov was discharged with observation at his place of residence and was prescribed another antitumor treatment, which will take place in April.

Roman Madyanov is a Soviet and Russian theater and film actor, Honored Artist of Russia, four times laureate of the Nika Award, laureate of the Golden Eagle Award for the films ‚Äú12‚Äù and ‚ÄúLeviathan‚Äù. He became famous thanks to his roles in the TV series ‚ÄúSoldiers‚Äù, ‚ÄúWapit Hunting‚Äù, ‚ÄúChaliapin‚Äù, in the films ‚ÄúSuper Beavers‚Äù, ‚ÄúAt the Command of the Pike‚Äù, ‚ÄúDream Team‚Äù. Tel Aviv is witnessing the largest anti-government rallies since the Hamas attack - thousands of people are demanding Netanyahu's resignation. Every Saturday, all of Israel is literally buzzing with citizen discontent - the reason for this is regular demonstrations against Netanyahu. Tel Aviv broke a record for the number of protesters this evening. Protests are also taking place in Jerusalem, where there are clashes with the police. A crowd of protesters does not give up trying to storm Netanyahu's residence, but they are prevented by police barriers placed in several rows.

During the demonstrations in Israel, 12 people have already been detained, but local media report that the number is growing. The protesters' demands have not changed - they are calling for early elections in Israel and a deal to free the hostages who have been held in the Gaza Strip for 176 days.

translation:
Forwarded from: The world today with "Yuri Podolyak"
Provocations of the Kyiv urchins: Samara prisoners...The enemy is very skillfully trying to cling to our pain points with information, trying to drive a wedge between society and the authorities. One of these topics is the topic of prisoner exchange.

Having received a rebuff in the desire to exchange the Azov criminals, of whom in fact there are still a lot of people in our captivity even after Mariupol and many of whom in recent months have received either long or life sentences, the enemy resorted to a very vile trick...

He collects our prisoners from one of the regions, records a video with them (you can see a screenshot of such a video), where the prisoners (obviously under pressure) ask to exchange them and declare that Russia abandoned them. And through various channels he is trying to throw it into the Russian information space.

At the same time, they (already behind the scenes, as people involved in exchanges told me) set conditions for our exchangers to exchange this group - to release the same number of outspoken nationalists ‚ÄúAzovites‚Äù. Many of whom have their hands up to their elbows in the blood of civilians of the same Mariupol (and not only).

The calculation is clear - to force our people to agree to an unequal exchange or... to stir up public discontent against the authorities.

Meanwhile, they are not at all interested in the fate of thousands of other prisoners. They are not interested in them. They have already written them off and abandoned them. For example, here are just two lists (list 1, list 2), which were published on Ukrainian resources dedicated to prisoners, where there are the names of more than 500 Armed Forces officers, whom our side has long offered for exchange.

But the Kyiv ghouls are not interested in ordinary Ukrainian men. For the bastard Kyiv regime, they are already used material. On the contrary, they are even angry with them because they surrendered and did not die for the interests of Britain and the United States.

Soldiers of the Dnepr Group of Troops (Forces) demonstrated the readiness of the coastal defense of the Kinburn Spit. Anti-aircraft crews will be the first to meet the enemy landing force. It takes less than a minute to deploy and aim the gun; a hail of armor-piercing cartridges, 900 rounds per minute, is ready to rain down on boats and boats of the Armed Forces of Ukraine 2 km from our shore. If the enemy, suffering losses, nevertheless continues to move towards the Kinburn Spit, automatic grenade launchers AGS "Plamya" will join in to repel the attack. Our machine gunners and riflemen will finally liquidate the demoralized landing groups. During such training sessions, military personnel of the Dnepr Group of Troops (Forces) practice interaction in different sections of the defense line. Underground passages stretch along the entire coast for tens of kilometers. They allow our soldiers to move unnoticed, and most importantly, safely. If in some area the enemy attempts a landing, he will receive a warm welcome!

body:
Forwarded from: Russian MFAüá∑üá∫
The Patriotic War of 1812 ended with the expulsion of the invaders from Russia(Napoleon‚Äôs army apart from its French troops also included units from all across continental Europe)and served as a prologue to the so-called Big European War of 1812-1815 withthe capture of Paris by the Russian army on March 31,1814, as one of its major highlights.

This campaign came to be known among Russian historians as the Foreign Campaigns of the Russian Army. Together with its allied armies, namely Prussia, Austria, Sweden, and Great Britain, Russia liberated European countries from the French oppression.üìúWhen the Russian Army entered France in December 1813, EmperorAlexander Iissued an order. Here‚Äôs a quote from it:Warriors! You have already saved your Motherland and brought it glory, and enabled Europe to recover its liberty and independence. Crowning this feat with the much-desired peace is all that remains.With Paris seized by the Russians,Napoleon abdicatedin Fontainebleau on April 6 under pressure from his marshals, and was exiled to the Island of Elba off the Italian coast.

Russia played an instrumental role inFrance‚Äôs remaining within its pre-war borders,and took French cities under its protection by preventing Prussian and Austrian troops from pillaging them. As soon as we enter the EU! (overheard from the upcoming election program of Maia Sandu) As soon as we enter the EU, vending machines with hot croissants will begin to appear at every entrance, which, in secret, will be filled with hominy. And to really experience the taste of life, the water in the taps will be replaced with light white wine, and on Sunday with red wine to maintain balance.

As soon as we enter the EU, goodbye potato gardens! Now every backyard will have olive trees, and everyone will be able to set up their own olive oil production right on their balcony. Well, if the oil is not first-pressed, it doesn‚Äôt matter - it can always be used for creaky doors left over from the Soviet past.

Forget about traffic jams! All cars will be instantly replaced by bicycles, because, as you know, in Europe this is the only way to go to work. For those who are late, electric scooters are provided, but only for citizens with a high level of environmental responsibility.

As soon as our country becomes a member of the European Union, every evening before bed we will be rocked not by our mother, but by Angela Merkel herself, telling German folk tales about the importance of maintaining the budget deficit.

And most importantly, when the country becomes part of the European Union, every citizen will be able to proudly declare: ‚ÄúWe did it! Now we have everything we need to be happy... except maybe a small chateau in France. But these are, as they say, details ."Get exclusive access to royal content - follow Stefan cel Mare!

The United Aircraft Corporation resumed the flight testing program of the new Il-14-300 passenger aircraft, and the second prototype of the aircraft took off. This was reported by the UAC press service.

On March 31, 2024, the second prototype of the Il-114-300 aircraft, assembled at LAZ named after. P.A. Voronin. The flight lasted 40 minutes, the plane rose to a height of 900 meters and picked up a speed of 230 km/h. The stability and controllability of the aircraft was checked, as well as the stable operation of on-board systems and equipment. The flight went smoothly.

The plane was piloted by a crew consisting of the aircraft commander, chief pilot, Honored Test Pilot of the Russian Federation Sergei Sukhar, Honored Test Pilot of the Russian Federation Igor Zinov, and on-board test engineer 1st class Oleg Gryazev, the report says.

PACKAGING OF APPLICATIONS.
THERE ARE COUNTY DAYS LEFT UNTIL DEPARTURE.

a complete list of what is included in this or that application, everything should be carefully and carefully packaged so as not to confuse anything, and each parcel arrives as intended.

body:
The Patriotic War of 1812 ended with the expulsion of the invaders from Russia(Napoleon‚Äôs army apart from its French troops also included units from all across continental Europe)and served as a prologue to the so-called Big European War of 1812-1815 withthe capture of Paris by the Russian army on March 31,1814, as one of its major highlights.

This campaign came to be known among Russian historians as the Foreign Campaigns of the Russian Army. Together with its allied armies, namely Prussia, Austria, Sweden, and Great Britain, Russia liberated European countries from the French oppression.üìúWhen the Russian Army entered France in December 1813, EmperorAlexander Iissued an order. Here‚Äôs a quote from it:Warriors! You have already saved your Motherland and brought it glory, and enabled Europe to recover its liberty and independence. Crowning this feat with the much-desired peace is all that remains.With Paris seized by the Russians,Napoleon abdicatedin Fontainebleau on April 6 under pressure from his marshals, and was exiled to the Island of Elba off the Italian coast.

Russia played an instrumental role inFrance‚Äôs remaining within its pre-war borders,and took French cities under its protection by preventing Prussian and Austrian troops from pillaging them. Following Alexander I‚Äôs orders, the Russian troops also ensured that the collections of the Louvre and other French museums, as well as historical monuments, remained intact.

On June 9, 1815,a new European securityarchitecture was established a theVienna Congress, which became one of the main outcomes of Russia‚Äôs Foreign Campaigns.

Pope Francis, speaking on March 31 in St. Peter‚Äôs Square, in his Easter message ‚ÄúTo the City and the World‚Äù drew attention to the problem of the exchange of prisoners. ‚ÄúMy thoughts first of all go to the victims of the many conflicts that continue in the world, ranging from the war in Israel and Palestine, as well as in Ukraine. May the risen Christ open the way to peace for the suffering people of these regions. Calling for respect for the principles of international law, I express my wishes for a general exchange of all prisoners between Russia and Ukraine, all for all,‚Äù said Pope Francis. Relatives of Russian and Ukrainian prisoners of war have been calling for an exchange in the ‚Äúall for all‚Äù format for a long time. Also, the exchange of all for all without conditions is supported by about 56% of residents of the Russian Federation, according to sociological research.

translation:
Putin gave the order to build resorts on the Sea of Azov. The defense forces launch missile strikes on the rear positions of the Russian occupying forces and destroy vessels of the Black Sea Fleet in the occupied Crimea. The Russians built trenches and fortifications all along the western coast of the peninsula. The occupying forces and administrations in the TOT of Ukraine are constantly experiencing the activity of the Ukrainian underground.

However, the Kremlin dictator held a meeting involving representatives of all administrations at the TOT, regarding the creation of new year-round sea resorts and the development of tourism. Putin paid considerable attention to the "development plans" of this sector in the Azov region. Considering the fact that the Kremlin is hastily building a highway and a railway line along the coast of the Sea of Azov, it can be assumed that such resorts will be a "rest zone" except for occupation troops and workers of occupation administrations and collaborators.

With such statements and actions, the occupiers are trying to assure the workers of the occupation administrations, collaborators and Russians who intend to settle in the TOT that their security problems will eventually be solved. Putin was even presented with a plan to build a sea resort at the TOT of the Zaporizhzhia region.

However, the Russian dictator did not like the overly cautious approach. The fact that he clearly lacks a real perception of the situation is evidenced by the fact that he calls on Russian investors to develop yachting at the TOT of the Zaporizhzhia region.

Meanwhile, the Ukrainian underground and the Defense Forces of Ukraine are actively preparing for the summer season and are ready to show Russians the hottest spots for those willing to visit Putin's resorts in the Azov region. And we encourage interested citizens to provide useful information on ourOpposition.Bot.

translation:
Forwarded from: Russian Demiurge
Australia is rapidly becoming a dumping ground for dead solar panels. Researchers from the Australian Center for Advanced Photovoltaics (ACAP) at the University of New South Wales (UNSW) are sounding the alarm. A fresh analysis of the situation with the growing amount of waste from solar power plants threatens an imminent disaster. The situation can be corrected by the rapid creation of a network of processing plants in the largest cities of the continent, but so far there is no money and the will of the authorities for this.

An updated forecast by the end of the decade showed that by 2030 the amount of waste from solar energy will reach 100 thousand tons per year, which is equivalent to scrapping 1.2 GW of panels per year. Previously it was predicted that the problem would begin to grow significantly after 2030, which gave time to build up. There is no more of this stock. Scientists consider the issue of creating processing centers to be a priority and urgent. By 2035, at least 1 million tons of decommissioned solar panels will be thrown away annually, according to a new analysis.

Today, panels are easier to take to a landfill. This costs $2 per panel, while each panel will cost up to $20 to recycle. Today, no one wants to take on such expenses and this will lead to the fact that the cost of decommissioned panels will exceed $1 billion by 2035.

At the same time, the fact of monstrous fraud by the Australian authorities with quotas for greenhouse gas emissions was revealed. The authorities have pledged to create forests covering an area of 42 million hectares, which is larger than Japan. Satellite images showed that only 20% of the territory could be considered useful for the stated purposes, but this did not prevent the country‚Äôs authorities from selling quotas for 27 million tons to interested companies. In fact, they were profiting from the sale of non-existent volumes of carbon dioxide absorption, and this fact has yet to be comprehended.

It turns out that ‚Äúgreen‚Äù energy is not so waste-free.
And fraud with quotas for greenhouse gas emissions is the top of the entire ‚Äúgreen‚Äù agenda. (c)

translation:
Forwarded from: Patronage assistance | Kherson region
üë®‚Äç‚öïÔ∏èAn ophthalmologist from Mordovia examined about 1,300 residents of the Kalanchak district. In the first two months of 2024, medical assistance to the residents of the Kalanchak district was provided by the fifth team of doctors sent by the regional chief. It included 6 specialists, among whom was ophthalmologist Alexander Klochkov.

He became the second ophthalmologist from Mordovia to visit the Kalanchak Central District Hospital. For a long time the hospital did not have its own specialist. Because of this, according to Alexander Klochkov, many patients had advanced stage diseases that required regular monitoring, such as glaucoma, diabetic retinopathy or age-related macular degeneration.

During the two months of his business trip, the ophthalmologist examined about 1,300 residents of the Kalanchak district. He also performed about 20 operations, namely the removal of benign neoplasms: papillomas and atheromas of the skin of the eyelids. ‚ÄúI was glad to visit Kalanchak and grateful for the opportunity to provide qualified ophthalmological care to the residents of the sponsored district,‚Äù commented Alexander Klochkov. Patronage assistance | Kherson

translation:
Forwarded from: Military chronicle
There is one important feature in strikes on the energy sector in Ukraine.üî∫After each combined strike by the Aerospace Forces, the Ukrainian side lays out a cruise missile flight map, from which several important conclusions can be drawn.

Firstly, a significant part of the Geran-2 drones, as before, is still launched from the southern section, just like a year ago. The launches are massive - from 30 to 70 UAVs are used in one raid. The Ukrainian side cannot stop these attacks. The only thing that remains is to fight drones in the air, but every month, due to thinning air defense and the growth of drone production, this is becoming increasingly difficult.

Secondly, information about the flights of cruise missiles and even the detailed routes of their deceptive maneuvers are tracked not only by the Ukrainian military, but also by the entire air/electronic reconnaissance of NATO forces, into which the Ukrainian air defense system has been quite tightly integrated almost since the beginning of the Northern Military District. However, nothing can still be done with the vast majority of X-101/X-555 missiles. Of course, there are isolated cases of missiles being hit, and some fail in flight, but their number is negligible compared to the breaking through X-101s and fits into the order to hit targets.

Thirdly, apparently, the air defense of the Sumy, Zhytomyr, Rivne, Ternopil and Khmelnytsky regions, not to mention Lviv and especially the central region with Kiev, operate with significant restrictions. With each missile strike, the Kh-101s enter from a predetermined direction, fly over several areas, circle for some time in Ukrainian airspace and then hit targets. Western Patriot/NASAMS/SAMP-T air defense systems are either not activated at all or are activated in the most critical situation.

Understanding the flight routes of cruise missiles does not help the Ukrainian side in any way in this regard. Rather, this benefits Russian intelligence, which is likely to monitor all activity regarding reports of strikes. @MChroniclesBot - send your photos and videos from the front. Subscribe to Military ChronicleMilitary Chronicle on VK

translation:
210 years since the Russian Army entered ParisParis was the largest city in Europe with a population of 714,600 people. The number of defenders of the city is estimated by historians from 28 to 45 thousand. The allies approached Paris from the northeast in three main columns with a total number of up to 100 thousand soldiers (of which 63 thousand were Russian).

The assault on the city lasted for 24 hours; the capitulation of Paris was signed at 2 a.m. on March 31 in the village of Lavillette.

At noon on March 19 (31), 1814, cavalry squadrons led by Emperor Alexander I triumphantly entered the capital of France. ‚ÄúAll the streets along which the allies had to pass, and all the streets adjacent to them, were filled with people who occupied even the roofs of the houses.‚Äù

translation:
üñºüé®Modern Art in the Middle Eastüî∏To understand the origins of Arab modernism, it is important to return to the spirit of optimism that arose in the post-war era when, having gained independence from imperial masters, artists of the Middle East and North Africa began the search for a pan-Arab identity. Cultural movements such as the New Vision group in Iraq, led by the innovative artist Dia Al-Azzawi, championed the idea of an Arab modernism united on ideological grounds rather than style. Since 2003, the Middle Eastern market for works has been growing steadily: prices for paintings by artist Farah Al-Nissa Zeid reached ¬£2.7 million in 2019. The opening of the Louvre Abu Dhabi, the success of the Arab Museum of Modern Art in Qatar and major exhibitions by artists such as Salua Rauda Shukair show that in the MENA region there is a great demand for art.üî∏The big trend in the Middle East right now is women artists. There are many works being written to empower women. For example, Afifa Aleibi and Shirin Neshat are amazing artists who have become a springboard for the younger generation. In addition, the leading trend in contemporary art is socio-political motives. But one of the most important themes that continues to dominate the market is Arabic calligraphy. For many years, countries such as Egypt, Lebanon and Syria have been the leading producers of contemporary art in the Middle East.

All the same.

‚ùóÔ∏èIsrael has proposed to the UN to disband UNRWA (the UN Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East) and transfer its functions to another agency, The Guardian reports, citing sources. This proposal followed a scandal when it turned out that some UNRWA employees were involved in a Hamas attack on Israel on 7 October and used UNRWA premises and vehicles.

According to an intelligence dossier cited by The Wall Street Journal, about 1,200 of the 12,000 UNRWA employees in the Gaza Strip have ties to Hamas and the Palestinian Islamic Jihad, and half of all UNRWA employees are closely related to members of these groups.

A dossier was also compiled showing that UNRWA facilities were being used for terrorist purposes. Israel further argues that there is a structural link between UNRWA and Hamas and that the personnel involved in the massacre are "just the tip of the iceberg."

A terrorist tunnel was discovered directly below the UNRWA headquarters and near its school, where they found numerous equipment, weapons and a data center with Hamas servers. Hamas equipment was connected to the power supply network of the UNRWA building.üìÆSubscribe to LOMOVKA

translation:
Homeless incident in Moscow's Lyublino - aggressive homeless people have filled the new buildings of PIK, where they litter, attack locals and in every possible way interfere with people's ability to live in their apartments
In the new residential complex ‚ÄúLublinsky Park‚Äù from PIK there is an invasion of homeless people or, as the locals themselves say, a zombie apocalypse. Homeless people have filled the entire area -
Show more
cafes, shops, buses, and the entrances became overnight accommodations for them. You can see them in different guises: drunk, sleeping naked on playgrounds, committing adultery with representatives of their own social group in public view, defecating on public property, local residents of Readovka said.
Nothing stops marginalized people on their way - changing the intercom codes does not help block the way to the staircases, which are cleaned by the residents themselves, while representatives of the management company only sympathize. Despite the characteristic signs of a violation of public order, police officers do not hold rowdies accountable. Adjacent to the Lublin residential complex is the Glinka homeless assistance center, founded even before the large-scale development of PIK on the site of an industrial zone. Homeless people from the outskirts of Moscow continue to flock there for food and shelter.
Due to the worsening problem, the center, together with the owners, created a chat where photographs of the location of street children are published every day. Later, a social patrol arrives and persuades the homeless to travel with them, but often receives a categorical refusal. However, the marginalized people themselves, after a visit to the center where they will be fed and washed, do not want to socialize. They return along the usual route to the residential complex, where they continue to beg and harass the locals.
Subscribe to Readovka

#Readovka_news #Moscow #Homeless

translation:
Anastasia Kashevarova Here is Bezsono and Admin are laughing at Channel One, which talks about psychotropic substances and chips in the hands of the terrorists who killed our people in Crocus. I had a non-contact fight with another lying machine.

It's actually not funny anymore. This is not just nonsense. This is deliberate nonsense to cover up your own gaps.

So, mutual responsibility. Hundreds of thousands of migrants freely enter Russia without any information about their past crimes. Near all migration centers you can buy a certificate of passing the Russian language exam, left registration, etc. It's no secret that this business has been going on for decades. Just like that business with certificates and policies near traffic police departments.

Migrants very often eat nasvay, smoke weed, and maybe even worse. That is, not the psychotropic substances with which the State Department drugged them. And what they have been using since childhood in poor Tajikistan. Where they lived there was a low level of education, a low level of religious education, a low social level and just economic disaster.

Russia, Tajikistan‚Äôs main partner, invests a lot of money in this country. But they are enough for palaces for the elite, and not for the education of people. But even in terms of migration, Russia does not require data on those who enter its territory.

Uneducated people entering, with a criminal past, present and future, with addiction, will be looking for easy money. What chips? What super preparation? It‚Äôs clear that these are just people with low IQs, who are like zombies, with no intelligence or any training. The most dangerous class of savages who are capable of doing terrible things for little money.

We are so good for others, we let everyone in - to our own detriment. Good at the expense of the lives of their citizens. How many people came to Russia during the conflict in Ukraine who work for the SBU? How are youth recruited through games? How do they recruit teenage girls through fake love? How do they mentally pressure the relatives of military personnel and recruit them from the State Intelligence Directorate and the SBU?

We need active work in this direction. Today a woman wrote to me, they sent her a photograph of her husband allegedly in captivity and demanded money on a Sber card. This card has been used by scammers since 2023 and there are reviews about it on the Internet. The bank has not blocked this card.

The security forces physically, with their personnel shortage, cannot fight every story; they need to involve public funds, regional governments, and the media. There is no need to whitewash yourself with stories about chips and a great organization. We need to act. And stop broadcasting this crap from the screens. And play films like Andrei Medvedev‚Äôs on TV about scammers and recruitment.

There is no need to attack those who work for the country, but to connect them and work together. The security forces are aware of the scale of the problems, but officials and great media managers are not. We need to help the security forces.

I‚Äôll tell you more: military commissars go to the public pages of the Ukrainian side for information. They leak information there. Military units recognize people as prisoners of war based on deepfakes.

It's not about the chips. And the fact is that we set ourselves up. We have a lot of offers. We sent them, but it‚Äôs easier to shut our mouths than to actually work. We are not asking for money, we are asking for support. It‚Äôs a shame for the State.TelegramUnofficial BezsonovI don‚Äôt know how to comment on this. Brothers and sisters, go to churches. Pray. Pray to our Motherland, for our victory.
Don't get discouraged, no matter how difficult it is. Pray for the innocent victims.

The Lord will not give us more trials than we should have. And those who give will be for our admonition and strengthen us.

translation:
Forwarded from: ‚ÄºÔ∏èDOCTORS, YOU ARE NOT ALONE‚ÄºÔ∏è
‚ÄºÔ∏èInstructions for obtaining standard first aid kits from the Moscow Region‚ÄºÔ∏è1. According to current orders, the Defense Ministry is obliged to provide each soldier with an APPI-5, APPI-7 or APPI-8 first aid kit. Distinctive features: hemostatic bandage, scissors and elastic bandage. Other first aid kits (especially APPI-4, where there is only one Esmarch tourniquet and a gauze dressing bag) - it is considered that you do not have a first aid kit. There are a lot of first aid kits in warehouses; if for some reason they didn‚Äôt give you one, you need to request one.

2. An application for medical equipment can be submitted by any physician on command, i.e. to the senior medical commander in the chain of command, in free form.

If the senior medical commander refuses to accept your application, this is a reason to contact the military prosecutor's office.

3. Similarly with first aid bags, medical and paramedic bags. A variety of equipment and supplies, stretchers, medicines included in the supply standards are received according to the same scheme.

4. In each direction there is an organization that supplies medical equipment (mobile storage department (MSD), medical center (SPH), oMedb, hospital, etc.) - everything is issued there. They are usually located next to hospitals where the wounded are brought (medrots, MOSN).

5. The application is submitted by the senior physician of your unit (unit) to his senior medical commander by any possible means (paper on transport with the wounded, by radio, ZSSPD). The delivery of medical supplies occurs via return flights of ambulance transport or other available methods.

6. If the unit is newly formed and is still at the training ground, then requests for supplies must be submitted to the head of the medical service of the training ground.

There is enough property in warehouses, ensure that you are supplied with everything you need. No one will do this except you!

Volunteers "Doctors, you are not alone!"@vrachivyneodni_channel

translation:
You left Russia and publicly oppose the war. Which countries should you not travel to? Part twoThe longer the war between Russia and Ukraine goes on, the more actively the Russian authorities persecute those who are against the war. Sometimes even leaving does not help: many countries agree to cooperate with the Kremlin on political matters. In addition, not all anti-war Russians have the opportunity to go to EU countries or the USA, where the risk of extradition to Russia tends to zero.

Meduza spoke with lawyers and compiled a list of countries that may be unsafe for emigrants from Russia. This is the second part of the list, the first we published the day before. The full list is available at this link.
description: Meduza is an online Russian news source that is currently in exile in Latvia. It used to be headed by Galina Timchenko, who was the editor-in-chief for Lenta.ru from 2004 to 2014. However, she was fired in 2014 and replaced by the pro-Putin Aleksei Goreslavsky, who has since left to work in the Kremlin. Following her dismissal, Timchenko created Meduza as an aggregator of handpicked Russian-language news. Over the years, Meduza has suffered a series of controversies, and while it is an anti-Kremlin outlet, it is known to post occasional eyebrow-raising content. It is blocked in Russia.
name: meduzalive

translation:
Forwarded from: Russian MFAüá∑üá∫
The Patriotic War of 1812, which ended with the expulsion of the interventionists (Napoleon‚Äôs army included not only French units, but the combined forces of most of continental Europe) from Russia became the beginning of the so-called. The Great European War of 1812-15, one of the brightest episodes of which was the capture of Paris by the Russian army on March 31, 1814. In domestic historiography, this campaign is designated as Foreign campaigns of the Russian army, during which, together with the armies of the allies - Prussia, Austria, Sweden, Great Britain, the state Europe were liberated from French oppression. The order of Emperor Alexander I upon entering France in December 1813 contained the following lines: Warriors! We have already saved and glorified our Fatherland, returned Europe‚Äôs freedom and independence. It remains to crown this great feat with the desired peace. After the capture of Paris by the Russians, on April 6 at Fontainebleau, Napoleon, under pressure from his marshals, abdicated the throne and was exiled to the island of Elba off the coast of Italy.

Russia played a vital role in preserving France within its borders and took French cities under its protection, preventing their plunder by Prussian and Austrian troops. The Russian army, by decree of Alexander I, ensured the inviolability of the collections of the Louvre and other French museums and historical monuments.

One of the most important results of the Foreign Campaign was the formation, during the Congress of Vienna on June 9, 1815, of a new European security system that ensured peace in Europe for four (!) decades. The Russian Empire played a key role in the formation of a new balance of power.üí¨ Briefing by M.V. Zakharova: We pay tribute to the memory of our heroic ancestors, draw strength and inspiration from their lives and exploits. The current Western rulers and the newly minted ‚ÄúNapoleons‚Äù, who are again threatening to send troops to the east, would also be advised not to forget the lessons of history. Read more About the campaign of 1813 About the campaign of 1814

The Kurds must be united so that we can solve our problems. This Congress can make it happen,‚Äù he added. The meeting was dominated by men. Madin Mirzoyeva was one of the few Kurdish women present. ‚ÄúKurdish families should send their daughters to school... and mothers should speak Kurdish with their children at home,‚Äù she said, highlighting how Kurdish mothers can contribute to the rise of nationalism abroad. Not Having their own country, there is a large Kurdish diaspora, many of whom have fled conflict or persecution in their homeland. translation: If in the spring you are not pleased with either the sun or the warmth, then there is nothing wrong with that: with the change of season, some people may be slightly ‚Äúshocked‚Äù emotionally. And if you think that ‚Äúsince it‚Äôs spring, there must be a good mood,‚Äù then suffering is guaranteed,‚Äù Horse noted. It is important to work on your perception, if one day it‚Äôs good and another day it‚Äôs bad, this is normal, the psychologist emphasized. translation:
Forwarded from: Voivode Broadcasts
Is this possible, only sUMPK? Can I get Masha for the buck? Then, may I?
No.

And why?

I'll explain it to you now.

Let's start with the simplest. FAB-5000, like FAB-9000, ultimately did not achieve the stated characteristics. No joke. Part of the explosive remained unattended.
No detonation.

Yes, there is evidence that similar beauties, hills in Afghanistan were turned into plains.

But, in the current conflict, given the saturation of air defense, they were useless.

Why?
Dimensions.
The bomb itself, plus the plane that will need to be attached, plus the low speed of gliding towards the target.

A big, simply huge target for any air defense. To put it very simply - a bomb the size of an airplane.

Carriers. FAB-9000 is generally a minus. There are no more planes that could be carried.

FAB-5000, in theory it‚Äôs possible, but those planes cannot maneuver from air defense after being dropped.

Therefore, we are waiting for FAB-3000 with UMPC, period.

translation:
Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
The first attack of assault drones in history. In Berdychi, which is now being liberated by Russian troops, a new promising Russian robotic platform was field tested.

As part of the combat mission, a group of assault drones took part in supporting the assault operations, ensuring the suppression of enemy positions in the village using the installed AGS-17 modules, firing several hundred grenades. During combat use, drones showed good results. The drones were able to continue operating even in conditions where losses of personnel and expensive equipment from enemy fire would have been inevitable.

The experience gained in combat use will be taken into account in the further production and development of assault robotic platforms. The combat use of such drones in Berdychi is actually similar to the first tank attack during the First World War.

A successful tracked base has great potential for developing a robotic platform for assault (installation of various combat modules) and support operations (transportation and installation of mines, removal of the wounded, transportation of cargo and equipment).

In the future, such platforms will take their place on the battlefield. Despite the fact that there are similar developments in the USA, Britain and China, it was Russia that was the first to use a group of assault drones in a real war.

The project is being implemented with the support of Boris Rozhin and Chingis Dambiev. The future has already arrived.

translation:
Forwarded from: Criminal Russia
Suspects of fraud against pensioners were detained in the Penza region. In September 2021, an individual entrepreneur organized a criminal scheme. The attacker recruited sales specialists. At the company's office, he taught them how to deceive clients and exert psychological pressure on them.

Fraudsters visited apartments and presented themselves as employees of an organization supplying electricity. They examined the electrical wiring, connecting various devices to the wires to make sure. Then, allegedly based on the obtained indicators, they provided false information about the high probability of short circuits that could lead to emergency situations. After which citizens were offered an alternative: either an expensive replacement of the wiring, or the purchase of a mains voltage control relay for six thousand rubles. In reality, there were no faults with electrical equipment in the apartments.

Currently, 42 people have been recognized as victims of the actions of the defendants.

A criminal case has been initiated under Part 4 of Art. 159 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation. The alleged leader of the organized group was placed under house arrest, and a preventive measure was chosen for the rest in the form of a written undertaking not to leave the place and proper behavior.

translation:
Large-scale floods affected several regions of Russia - roads, residential buildings, bridges and infrastructure were flooded in hundreds of settlements
Flooding caused by melt water continues in Russian regions. The storm is raging most severely in the Altai Territory, but with floods
Show more
A number of subjects of the Volga region are also covered - in particular, the Orenburg, Samara, Saratov and Ulyanovsk regions. Flooding is also observed in the Kaluga region - three bridges were flooded there: on Mikhailovskaya, Chernosvitinskaya streets and in the village of Babenki.
In the Altai Territory, where a state of emergency is in effect, 127 houses and about 1,000 household plots in 37 settlements are flooded, 77 people are in temporary temporary accommodation. According to the Ministry of Emergency Situations, one of the regional highways was also destroyed, and eight sections of roads were blocked. The most difficult flood situation is observed in the Mikhailovsky district.
In the Orenburg region, in the Ilek district, an electrical substation went under water, it had to be turned off and the backup power supply used. In the Volga region, the fight against melt water is complicated by precipitation in the form of rain and sleet.

In addition to the topic of the first group use of https://t.me/boris_rozhin/118537 assault drones.

Here are videos and photos from tests of British and American ground attack drones.
Army Warfighting Experiment test video - 2020. Photos of American drones - 2021.

They have been developing similar developments for quite some time. Just like in China. We were lagging behind them before the start of the SVO. But since war is the engine of progress, we are not only catching up with them, but also ahead of them in many issues, because the path from idea to practical application has become shorter for us. The race for land assault drones in the next decade will be no less exciting than the race for drones and sea drones. It will change both the battlefield and the image of the products used, which in 5-10 years will be seriously different from the first samples that we see on land, on water and in the air now. We cannot lag behind in this race, since the partial robotization of war is inevitable (although the role of humans will remain dominant for a very long time - technology without people is dead).

After being wounded, Kuzminov was able to run a little, then fell, and the killers ran over him several times with a car. The killers' car was found a few days later - it was completely burned out. It took specialists only a week to determine the make of the car.‚ñ™Ô∏èThe shell casings became an important clue: Kuzminov was shot with a Makarov pistol. The Civil Aviation Administration of China (CAAC) reported that there were about 1.27 million UAVs registered nationwide at the end of 2023, up 32.2% from the previous year.

About 19 thousand Chinese companies reported using drones in their activities. Over 194 thousand Chinese citizens have valid drone pilot certificates. It also reported that civilian drones flew 23.11 million hours across the country last year, up 11.8% from 2022.

In particular, drones are widely used in agriculture, forestry, livestock farming and fishing, as well as in entertainment and aerial photography. Some cities have begun testing unmanned aerial delivery. Among other things, the CAAC has published recommendations for the creation of pilot UAV zones: at the moment, 17 such zones and three bases have been approved. Forwarded from: Fisherman
üáØüáµüá®üá≥üáπüáºüá∫üá∏Countries in the Asia-Pacific region continue to strengthen their military capabilities - Japanese media write that the government in Tokyo plans to allocate five airports and 11 seaports for use by the Self-Defense Forces and Coast Guard.

Japanese military personnel will be able to freely use them for exercises. Some infrastructure facilities will be modernized, for example, existing runways at airports will be expanded. It is noteworthy that half of the facilities are located in Okinawa Prefecture on the southwestern island of Kyushu. They are located closest to Taiwan and the Senkaku Islands, control over which is disputed by both Japan and China.

By the way, the media began to write more and more about the latter territories, since last year the PRC began to actively confirm its sovereignty over them by sending its ships there. The Japanese also frequently conduct joint exercises with the United States in relative proximity to the Senkaku Islands.

In general, these plans coincide with the general course of the Japanese government to strengthen the country's defensive potential. However, it is still not clear whether they will be implemented - there have been no official statements from the country's authorities. Providing access to civilian infrastructure should take place after negotiations with the local population. Residents of the same Okinawa prefecture are often negatively disposed towards such initiatives. Therefore, we should not exclude the possibility that the government‚Äôs likely plans may be postponed indefinitely due to citizens‚Äô dissatisfaction.

At the same time, there is no doubt that the US armed forces will also have access to the infrastructure. Moreover, recently one of Washington‚Äôs goals is to expand military influence in the Asia-Pacific region. High resolution mapEnglish version#Japan#China#Taiwan#USA@ rybartogether with @awaken_dragonSupport us

translation:
‚úçVice-Rector of the Diplomatic Academy of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Russia O.G. Karpovich
 
A thorny path to de-escalationüí¨Despite the tragic events that occurred last week in Russia, European politicians continue to enthusiastically discuss the prospects of sending their countries' armed forces to Ukraine. <...>
 
The discussion launched by French President Emmanuel Macron concerns specifically the sending of full-fledged units to Ukraine. Until recently, such discussions might have seemed absurd and divorced from reality. <...> However, the failure of hopes of inflicting a strategic defeat on Moscow at the hands of Ukrainians and sanctions strikes forced individual participants in the anti-Russian coalition to begin to consider options that seemed incredible for the development of events.‚òù The reason for the emergence of the corresponding discussion is obvious. Having relied on a blitzkrieg against Russia, designed to disintegrate our country by eliminating it from the club of great powers, the West embarked on an unprecedented adventure that led its political elites to a logical dead end. Against the backdrop of more and more failures and defeats of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, the positions of supporters of the war to the last Ukrainian are beginning to come apart at the seams.
 
<...>
 
Of course, the prospect of activating Article 5 of the NATO Charter, which can be considered a direct road to a nuclear clash, does not please many sober-minded Western politicians. But do they still have the opportunity to influence the development of events? Russia, of course, will do everything possible to explain to Macron and his support group the harmfulness of the transition to such thoughtless (not to say insane) actions that put the entire European continent at risk and, no matter how pathetic it may sound, the entire world civilization.
 
It is worth noting that, once on Ukrainian territory, soldiers of any army allied to Kyiv will turn into a legitimate target for the Russian armed forces and will be immediately destroyed. <...>‚ùóÔ∏èThis is not our choice, and we will try to reason with the enemy until the end.

translation:
The famous astronomer from Crimea Gennady Borisov reported that he had discovered a new asteroid.

True, the space object had already flown near the Earth at about 19.00 Moscow time on Sunday at a distance of 28-30 thousand kilometers.

Thus, the asteroid could affect the orbits of geostationary satellites. However, the guest from space flew on safely.

Astronomer Gennady Borisov is known for the fact that in 2019 he discovered the first interstellar comet, which flew into the Solar System from beyond its limits and was of interstellar origin.

The comet was named after its discoverer 2I/Borisov.

translation:
The New York Times published details of the murder of the traitorous pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a Russian Mi-8 into Ukraine in August. Citing sources in the Spanish Civil Guard, the newspaper reports that Kuzminov was shot 6 times, and then his body was run over in a car. At the murder scene, investigators found shell casings from 9-mm cartridges for a Makarov pistol.

‚ÄúThis was a clear signal: I will find you, I will kill you, I will crush you and humiliate you,‚Äù a senior source overseeing the investigation told the publication.

The shell casings, according to investigators, are the key to unraveling the identity of the killers. This, as the newspaper noted, is ‚Äústandard ammunition from the former communist bloc.‚Äù
The murder was carried out by professionals, the sources also said.

It has not yet been established how Kuzminov was tracked down, who after hijacking a helicopter in Ukraine moved to the Spanish city of Villajoysa. NYT, citing two sources, writes that he contacted his ex-girlfriend, who lives in Russia, and invited her to his place.

In Spain, Kuzminov, according to the newspaper, drove a black Mercedes, went to bars popular among immigrants from the Russian Federation and Ukraine, and ‚Äúburned‚Äù the money received for ferrying a helicopter from the Ukrainian authorities. Subscribe to Telegram SOLOVYOV!

translation:
The mayor of Paris opposed the participation of athletes from Russia and Belarus in the 2024 Olympics. ‚ÄúI want to tell Russian and Belarusian athletes that they will not be welcome in Paris,‚Äù Anne Hidalgo said during her visit to Kyiv on March 28.

Hidalgo added that Paris will support Ukrainian athletes during the Olympics. ‚ÄúParis will welcome you as heroes, you will feel at home in Paris,‚Äù she said.

The official representative of the Russian Foreign Ministry, Maria Zakharova, commenting on Hidalgo‚Äôs words, suggested ‚Äúselecting some French products that are now widely represented in Russia, and declaring that ‚Äòthey will not be happy‚Äô.‚Äù

The mayor of Paris, Anne Hidalgo, said in January 2023 that she supported the participation of athletes from Russia and Belarus in the Olympics under a neutral flag. A few weeks later, Le Monde writes, Hidalgo changed her position, saying that there was no such thing as a neutral flag. She noted that in France they are not going to honor a country that attacks another.
description: Meduza is an online Russian news source that is currently in exile in Latvia. It used to be headed by Galina Timchenko, who was the editor-in-chief for Lenta.ru from 2004 to 2014. However, she was fired in 2014 and replaced by the pro-Putin Aleksei Goreslavsky, who has since left to work in the Kremlin. Following her dismissal, Timchenko created Meduza as an aggregator of handpicked Russian-language news. Over the years, Meduza has suffered a series of controversies, and while it is an anti-Kremlin outlet, it is known to post occasional eyebrow-raising content. It is blocked in Russia.

translation:
Forwarded from: Readovka explains
Electric power industry is the ‚ÄúAchilles heel‚Äù of Ukraine Emergency power outages were applied in Odessa and nearby areas in Ukraine due to damage to energy equipment, says the Ukrenergo Telegram channel. On Sunday, the Ukrainian Armed Forces announced that a fire occurred at an energy facility in the Odessa region after explosions, and several settlements were cut off from power. The Odessa city administration reported a complete stop of electric transport. ‚ÄúDue to damage to equipment, power engineers were forced to apply emergency shutdowns in the city of Odessa and surrounding areas. As consumption increases, their volume may increase,‚Äù says the company‚Äôs statement. The significance of this event cannot be exaggerated. While the strikes were carried out on purely military targets, ukropaganda broadcast that ‚Äúall missiles were shot down,‚Äù and these statements could neither be refuted nor confirmed. After all, this does not directly concern the average person, and the destruction of the residential sector caused by the work of the Ukrainian air defense could always be attributed to the ‚Äúbloodthirstiness of the orcs.‚Äù

But now that the attacks have spread to the energy infrastructure, it is impossible to convince one‚Äôs own population that all attacks have been repulsed. These statements will be disavowed literally by a ‚Äúlight bulb going out.‚Äù

Meanwhile, the policy of ‚Äúcutting off Ukraine from electricity‚Äù is acquiring more and more tangible and clear contours. In addition to the sobering effect on the population of the Square, the destruction of energy capacities directly affects the speed and efficiency of the construction of defense lines and the operation of the military-industrial complex as a whole. The use of many diesel generators depletes Ukrainian reserves fuels and lubricants, and as entire sections of railway networks are de-energized, the load on motor transport is only growing, and the general trend of transport and logistics collapse in Ukraine is gaining momentum by leaps and bounds. Electric power industry is becoming its ‚ÄúAchilles heel‚Äù, and the increase in impacts on it will only increase. For data Russia has every opportunity to achieve goals, but Ukraine literally has nothing to oppose to this.

translation:
Horses help fighters remember how to walk correctly. It is no secret that horses are used in rehabilitation. But it‚Äôs one thing when psychological problems are treated with the help of these beautiful animals, and quite another when a person without legs is put on a horse. It looks scary, but in reality everything is completely different.

Director of the ANO Center for Adaptive Riding Anna Igorevna Knyazeva told us that it turns out that walking on a horse helps the body, which has become unaccustomed to the functioning inherent in nature, to remember what it is like to walk correctly. And this has a very good effect on the health of the person being rehabilitated.

For more information about the work on the rehabilitation of wounded soldiers at the Nalmes Center for Adaptive Riding and Equestrian Sports, watch this evening on our channel.@wargonzo*our project exists with funds from subscribers, help card4276 3801 4149 1378

Here is the first captured M-777 captured in the summer of 2022. In 2022, she was already exhibited at Patriot, but the exhibition was much simpler then. In 2023, the exhibition was already almost museum level.

Well, this year, given how many different things have been captured by our troops in recent months, the exhibition of trophies in Patriot Park is sure to be a hit. There are chances to see captured Leopards and Abrams, among others.
"Bradley" and "Marder" will definitely be there.

In fact, from the point of view of captured foreign armored vehicles, our museums are now receiving the largest addition since the Great Patriotic War.

In general, I recommend visiting Alabino in August, when the exhibition opens.

translation:
Spring conscription has begun in Russia Russian dictator Vladimir Putin signed a decree on the spring conscription for military service for 150,000 people aged 18 to 30.

The text of the decree, which was signed by the Kremlin autocrat on Sunday, March 31, states that in the period from April 1 to July 15, 150,000 people who are not in the reserve and are conscripts will be called up for military service in Russia.

150,000 is only the officially declared quota, the real number can be much higher. This quota also includes young men from the TOT of the Crimean Peninsula and the TOT of the Donetsk and Luhansk regions, where the local "military commissars" managed to update the data of persons who fall under the criteria for conscription.

The Center of National Resistance warns the male population of TOT between the ages of 18 and 30, who may potentially be involved in hostilities against the Defense Forces of Ukraine, about the need to leave their place of permanent residence or these territories in general. In the case of forced mobilization or conscription, it is necessary to follow the algorithm of surrender under favorable circumstances.

translation:
Forwarded from: Kherson News Agency
üåπEducational journey: raccoon Kherson in the city of a million roses In any city there are places about which you can say: ‚ÄúIf you haven‚Äôt been, then you haven‚Äôt seen!‚Äù These often include monuments, parks, and memorial buildings.

Today the raccoon Kherson arrived in Donetsk - a city that makes you fall in love at first sight. This is part of his route to deliver letters from military personnel to children in Greater Russia. The diligent animal has studied the city and is ready to share five locations that everyone should visit. One of the symbols of the city, and the whole of Donbass, is the monument ‚ÄúGlory to Miner‚Äôs Labor‚Äù, installed on Shakhterskaya Square in the Kievsky district of Donetsk. The piece of coal that the miner holds effortlessly is made of aluminum and weighs 90 kg. The memorial ‚ÄúTo Your Liberators, Donbass‚Äù in the park named after. Lenin Komsomol dedicated to the heroes of the Great Patriotic War. The total height of the monument is more than 30 meters, it is one of the highest monuments of military history in the region, at its foot is the WWII Museum. The bust of A. S. Pushkin on the boulevard of the same name in the center of Donetsk is a traditional point of attraction for young people and people of art. In peacetime, festivals and exhibitions were often held near the ‚ÄúHead,‚Äù as the monument was popularly called. This year the monument turns 55 years old. The park of forged figures near the city hall is full of roses that ‚Äúbloom‚Äù at any time of the year, and is inhabited by various characters - from blacksmiths and saints to fairy-tale heroes. Craftsmen from all over the world worked to create exhibits for the park. The walk will definitely take a long time - allow plenty of time! Donetsk received the Tsar Cannon of the largest caliber in the world as a gift from Moscow. The mass of the replica cannon is 44 tons, and the carriage is 20 tons. Nearby are four cast iron cores with a total mass of almost 4.5 tons. In size, the Donetsk Tsar Cannon is only slightly different from the original.üíåThe creator of the comic is a famous Russian journalist, member of the Public Chamber of the Russian Federation Alexander Malkevich@alexandr_malkevich Photo: telegram channel ‚ÄúRaccoon from Kherson‚Äù Subscribe to the Kherson News Agency in TG, VK and OK

translation:
The moment of Odessa shutdown.

Not a happy video at all. Despite the fact that we in Crimea experienced a blackout because of Ukraine, and I remember very well the many problems that a power outage brings.

You can, of course, say that this is karma, but not in the case of Odessa, that‚Äôs for sure. Shutting down Lvov would be much fairer from this point of view. But the question in this case does not lie in the plane of justice/karma.

A purely military, unemotional assessment of strikes shows that the purpose of ‚Äúturning off the switch‚Äù is to deprive the enemy of the opportunity to use:

- railway transport infrastructure. Up to 75% of the locomotive fleet there are electric locomotives. Different gauges do not make it possible to quickly catch up with diesel locomotives from Europe. Why hit traction substations and bridges if by simply turning off the power supply, we immediately reduce the ability to deliver goods by four times.

-quarries and reinforced concrete plants. For the crankcases to work, energy is needed for crushers and screens, without this you cannot get gravel and sand. Cement requires continuous operation of hot furnaces, and this is difficult to organize with generators alone. And also the melting of metal to obtain reinforcement... all this sharply slows down the process of fortification construction, which is also burdened by logistical difficulties (see point 1)

-carry out repairs and production of military equipment. At the very least, the process is becoming more complicated.

-Another consequence will be a sharp increase in the required fuel consumption for the operation of many generators. Which automatically increases the load on logistics, which is already reduced by 4 times by railway. And transferring to highways requires a lot more people, while the drivers there are already in trouble due to mobilization. Plus, logistics centers are already overloaded, and the condition of the roads is sad.

-another consequence is difficulty in the operation of the information dome. You can‚Äôt watch a telethon without light, but a few days without being a zombie, and the overwrought mood begins to let go, reality knocks on your head. Plus a fertile field for negative rumors, which also changes resistance to struggle. Russian Engineer -‚úÖsubscribe

translation:
Forwarded from: Remote sensing satellite
RSC "Progress" ensured the launch of the thousandth spacecraft of its own design. On March 31, 2024, at 12:36 am Moscow time, from site 31 of the Baikonur Cosmodrome, the Soyuz-2-1b launch vehicle successfully launched the Earth remote sensing spacecraft "Resurs-P" No. 4. The launch vehicle and spacecraft were developed and manufactured by RSC Progress JSC.

"Resurs-P" No. 4 is the thousandth spacecraft developed and produced by the Progress RSC.

The Resurs-P No. 4 spacecraft is designed to observe the Earth's surface in the visible and near-infrared ranges.

There are three types of survey equipment installed on ‚ÄúResurs-P‚Äù No. 4: optical-electronic equipment with high-detail resolution ‚ÄúGeoton-L1‚Äù, which allows panchromatic photography of the earth‚Äôs surface with a resolution of up to 1 m; a complex of wide-spectrum multispectral equipment and hyperspectral equipment. Source#Russia

translation:
‚ÄúDoes your dog understand when you say ‚Äòfetch the ball‚Äô? A new study in Hungary says yes: Dogs are smarter than many people think, and understand not only commands, but also the meaning of individual words.

‚ÄúThis conclusion was reached during experiments by scientists from the University of Budapest, who published an article in the journal Current Biology. During the study, which involved 18 dogs, the animals' brain activity was measured using sensors when they were shown various objects.
The researchers noted that if the named and shown object were the same, one reaction was noted, and when the animal was deceived (for example, they said ‚Äúball‚Äù and showed another toy), the brain reacted differently. Scientists consider this evidence that dogs know the names of objects and are able to understand individual words of human speech."

Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
This war has a global significance. This is a war for the right to exist for our state and at the same time for the right to life for every person. For the dignity of our nation and for every nation that strives for its own destiny. This is a war so that no one dares to become a beast towards others.

And our people killed by the occupiers, whose bodies were lying on the streets of Buchi, were evidence that no one in the world can stay away from this battle. Because it is here, in Ukraine, protecting our people, our lives, our state, that humanity wins.

In order to launch such aggressions against others, Russia first destroyed its own morality and made violence and hatred its ideology. Such systems do not stop just like that. The force stops them. Unity stops them. Determination and understanding - exactly what they want to destroy.

I thank everyone in the world who really helps us. Glory to our strong people, our soldiers! Glory to all who protect humanity and life! Glory to Ukraine!

Forwarded from: Rybar in English
‚ùóÔ∏èüá∑üá∫üá∫üá¶Offensive West of Donetsk: Liberation of VodyanoySituation at the end of March 31, 2024

Since the end of 2022, Russian troops have been engaged in fierce battles forVodyane. Today, the village was successfully liberated by soldiers of the 9th Separate Guards Motorized Rifle Brigade.

The Russian Ministry of Defense has not yet commented on this development. However, online footage clearly shows the DPR flag flying over a house on the western outskirts of the village.

Vodyanoy itself comprises onlyGagarin Street, lined with dilapidated buildings on both sides. The offensive in this area faced significant challenges due to the AFU's control over the neighboring village ofPervomaiskoye.

To prevent a counterattack from Ukrainian forces in the south, Russian troops destroyed the bridge between the two settlements. The liberation of Vodyanoy will also intensify pressure on Pervomaisky, complicating the enemy's position there.‚ùóÔ∏èTwo weeks prior, Russian Armed Forces units had alreadyexpanded their control zonein Pervomaisky, nearing the ruins of thePershotravnevka-35substation at the village center. However, due to insufficient personnel, determining the exact frontline configuration in the populated area remains a challenge.üîªSuccess in this front section has brought Russian military personnel closer to commencing the battle forNetailovoand advancing further west. The primary objective is to push the frontline away fromDonetskas much as possible to safeguard its residents from ongoing enemy attacks.High-resolution mapEnglish versionFor any updates on the situation or to highlight your unit's successes, feel free to contact us through the feedback bot@rybar_feedback_bot.

translation:
Biden's congratulations to transgender people on their Easter day today, Easter, caused outrage among conservatives, but also wider bewilderment. To explain this somewhat absurd act, it is worth recalling that the day of ‚Äútransgender visibility‚Äù has been celebrated by the White House on March 31 since 2021, just for the first time it coincided with Easter. The administration only repeated its annual words, but this time they sounded especially defiant.

The conservative Fox Channel lists a variety of LGBT-themed days celebrated by the White House or the community. https://www.foxnews.com/politics/white-house-celebrates-trans-holiday-easter-us-extensive- list-days-devoted-lgbt-causesFox News3 months and 28 days: LGBTQ events clog calendar as White House faces backlash o...The U.S. celebrates dozens of LGBT holidays and weeks, data shows, including the White House celebrating Transgender Day of Visibility on Easter Sunday.

translation:
(ends, starts here)

At the same time, armored cavalry brigades are clearly ‚Äútailored‚Äù for colonial wars in terms of the composition of their weapons. For example, light wheeled armored vehicles, including the AMX-10RC ‚Äúlight tanks‚Äù that have proven poorly in Ukraine. Which are definitely not capable of being either tanks or a means of fire reinforcement in a modern war with a first-class enemy, which without a doubt is the Russian Armed Forces today. And if they are transferred to Ukraine, especially without air support, these units will suffer very heavy losses and will be quickly defeated.

The same applies to the 27th Mountain Infantry and 11th Airborne Brigades, which are part of the 1st and 3rd Divisions, respectively. Thus, the only two ‚Äúheavy‚Äù brigades (2nd and 7th armored brigades, each approximately 7,500 strong) are best suited for operations in Ukraine, armed with modern Leclerc tanks and VBCI wheeled heavy infantry fighting vehicles.

Moreover, after transferring 30 Caesar howitzers to Ukraine to cover their group on the front line, the French also have modern artillery only for these two brigades (about two artillery regiments).

Thus, what they are talking about in France today about 20,000 troops in Ukraine is exactly all the forces (including special operations forces) that Macron is generally able to put on the battlefield today against a modern army. After their defeat, France will essentially have no army. Only light units will remain to fight the ‚ÄúPapuans.‚Äù Telegram The world today with ‚ÄúYuri Podolyak‚Äù French Army: or what the ‚ÄúGali fighting cock‚Äù can put up in Ukraine

The chance that Ukraine will be able to liberate its territories in the next few years ‚Äútends to zero.‚Äù This opinion was expressed in X by Bild military analyst Julian Repke.

In his opinion, Kyiv now has two scenarios for the development of the situation. The first is stopping the war along the front line.

The second is further territorial losses due to the Russian advance.

According to Roepke, these scenarios can still be averted "if the quality and quantity of Western arms supplies change dramatically over the course of the year and Ukraine mobilizes at least 300,000 troops in the next twelve months."

However, he writes that such a scenario is similar to ‚Äúwishful thinking.‚Äù

An accomplice of the Ukrainian special services was caught transferring confidential data to Kyiv curators. The information leak threatened the security of Russia and all residents of the Zaporozhye region.

translation:
A father of 13 children beats orcs in the Zaporozhye direction

Before the war, he was a coach in Greco-Roman wrestling and a parent-educator of a family-type orphanage, and now he is a fighter of the 128th separate mountain-assault brigade of the Transcarpathian region with the call sign "Faza", who controls a drone and fires a mortar at the enemy in the Zaporozhye direction . His reliable rear at the front is one of his adopted sons - 20-year-old Mykhailo (call sign "Myth").

"Phase" comes from the city of Zhmerinka. Together with his wife, they raise 13 children. All are accepted. In 2016, the fighter took part in anti-terrorist operations. He says he knew for sure that there would be a big war. Like, there was a pressure in the air.

"The fact that we are now with Mykhailo is good. Easier together, more reliable. We cover each other's backs. I am 100% sure of him," Faza tells about his son. He did not hide the fact that he was very worried about him and even tried to refuse when he said that he was going to the army, - reports 061.TelegramWhatsAppInstagram

translation:
The European Parliament demands an investigation into the bribery of EU politicians by Russia. This scheme was managed by Viktor Medvedchuk and co. The Czech counter-intelligence with the assistance of the SBU exposed their own network the day before. It was headed by Viktor Medvedchuk together with Artem Marchevsky, a former producer of 112.

With the help of the "Voice of Europe" media company, politicians from at least 6 countries - Germany, France, Poland, Belgium, the Netherlands, and Hungary - were financed. Right-wing politicians, such as from the German AfD party, were often paid for commenting on the site. The goal was to get as many pro-Russian forces as possible into the European Parliament. Sanctions were imposed on "Voice of Europe", and news no longer appears there on Twitter. In total, this platform offered materials in 15 languages. Money was transferred to politicians at personal meetings or in cryptocurrency.

Hungarian journalist Csaba Kants showed the participants of the scheme. Among them is the French party "National Union" led by Marine Le Pen.

translation:
New geothermal energy project launched in Kenya Kenya's booming geothermal sector has reached another milestone with the signing of a memorandum of understanding between local data center company EcoCloud and Abu Dhabi technology firm G42 to build a data center that will operate exclusively on geothermal energy.
 
Speaking at the signing ceremony, which was witnessed by President William Ruto, EcoCloud CEO Amos Sivoy said: ‚ÄúBy harnessing the power of geothermal energy, we are not only meeting the region's data needs, but also setting a new standard for green infrastructure. This partnership underscores our commitment to a greener and more sustainable future in Africa and beyond.‚Äù
 
Data centers require enormous amounts of power, especially with the growing use of power-hungry AI-based applications. Any power outage has potentially critical consequences for their operations.

body:
The New York Times has uncovered chilling details surrounding the murder of Maxim Kuzminov, a Russian pilot who had hijacked a helicopter to Ukraine.According to the report, two assailants orchestrated the attack, fatally shooting Kuzminov six times before callously running over his lifeless body with a vehicle.

At the crime scene, authorities discovered 9-mm shell casings, indicating the use of a Makarov pistol. A spokesperson for the Spanish police investigating the incident described the act as a blatant message of intimidation: "I will find you, I will kill you, I will crush you and humiliate you."

Senior police officials, speaking anonymously to reporters, drew parallels between Kuzminov's murder and other targeted attacks associated with the Kremlin.

In a chilling twist, two high-ranking officials suggested to The New York Times that Kuzminov's movements may have been tracked after he made contact with his ex-girlfriend in Russia, whom he had invited to join him in Spain.

translation:
üá∑üá∫üá∫üá¶Chronicle of a special military operation for March 31, 2024 Last night, Russian troops launched further attacks on energy complex facilities in nine regions of the so-called. Ukraine. A series of hits hit targets in the Lviv, Ivano-Frankivsk and Ternopil regions, and Ukrenergo announced emergency shutdowns in the Odessa region.

In turn, Ukrainian formations continue to shell the Russian border area: in the Belgorod region, a resident of the village of Dunayka was killed, another woman was injured. There were also attacks on the rear regions: three UAVs were intercepted in the Yaroslavl region, but there was no damage.

In the special military operation zone, fierce fighting continues along the entire line of contact. In the Seversky and Bakhmut directions, the parties increased the intensity of artillery strikes, and near Avdeevka, units of the Russian Armed Forces resumed attacks in the Berdychi-Tonenkoye sector.

To the west of Donetsk, Russian troops liberated the village of Vodyanoye: a Russian flag was hoisted on the western outskirts of the village. Success in this sector brought the Russian Armed Forces even closer to the occupation of neighboring Pervomaiskoye and further battles for Netailovo.

In the Kherson direction, the enemy somewhat reduced the activity of transferring forces to the islands and Krynki, but increased the frequency of strikes with HIMARS missiles. At the same time, the command of the Armed Forces of Ukraine does not intend to abandon plans to expand the bridgehead and create new points of tension on the left bank of the Dnieper. A detailed analytical report on the events in the Special Military Operation zone is available on our closed channel @rybar_plus_bot Maps in high resolution:

translation:
Forwarded from: Wild Field
On this day 210 years ago, Russian troops took Paris: Emperor Alexander I triumphantly entered the streets of the French capital. Thus ended the longest war of the 19th century. The famous Foreign Campaign of the Russian Army was, in fact, a large-scale operation to liberate Europe from Napoleonic troops: it took place over a space of hundreds of kilometers between the Baltic Sea and Brest-Litovsk, the Neman and the Rhine.

Russian troops gave freedom to dozens of European cities, including such large ones as Berlin and Amsterdam. And Russia received new heroes - Mikhail Barclay de Tolly, Leonty Korenny and Alexander Benkendorf.

After the capture of Paris, France capitulated and Napoleon abdicated power. His army conquered all of Europe, but was defeated in Russia in 1812.

At the entrance to Paris, the Russian cavalcade was led by horse guards and Cossacks, followed by hussars and cuirassiers of the Prussian Guard, then dragoons and hussars of the Russian Guard rode.

As they moved towards the city center, the mood of the wary public changed: Parisians, who were expecting imminent reprisals for Moscow devastated in 1812, saw that the conquerors were behaving with restraint and friendliness. The crowd began to hear greetings addressed to the Russian Emperor. And when Alexander I was surrounded by a crowd at the Champs Elysees, he heard: ‚ÄúWe have been waiting for the arrival of Your Majesty for a long time!‚Äù

During his stay in Paris, the emperor issued strict instructions not to offend peaceful Frenchmen and, in general, to behave with dignity and not to rob. This was especially surprising compared to how barbarically the French behaved in Moscow. The short stay of Russian troops in Paris left a separate mark on the culture and life of the country. The capture of Paris became not just a glorious page in Russian history, but also an example of courage, perseverance and generosity of the Russian army, an example on which officers of all subsequent generations relied, including those who defends Russia today.
