The counter-terrorism operation regime in Dagestan has been cancelled. THIS MATERIAL (INFORMATION) WAS PRODUCED AND DISTRIBUTED BY A FOREIGN AGENT, LLC "MEMO", OR CONCERNES THE ACTIVITIES OF A FOREIGN AGENT, LLC "MEMO".18+

The counter-terrorist operation regime in Makhachkala and Kaspiysk was canceled after the detention of three terrorism suspects, security officials reported.

As the "Caucasian Knot" wrote, three people who planned terrorist attacks were detained in Makhachkala and Kaspiysk during a counter-terrorism operation, the National Anti-Terrorism Committee said. According to the department, the detainees were found with automatic weapons, ammunition and an improvised explosive device. There were no casualties among civilians or losses among security forces, the committee reported.

translation:
Forwarded from: üöÄTIME FOR THE FIRSTüöÄ
The other day, the guys and I met with a soldier of the Lynx special assault unit, a direct participant in the Special Military Operation. He himself is a Kharkov resident and in 2022 he decided to liberate his homeland from the yoke of the Nazi Kyiv regime.

He shared with us his memories from the front, told us why it was so important for him to take part in the North Military District and why he made such a courageous decision to go to the battlefield. We have once again seen how heroically our compatriots act in such difficult conditions. They are real heroes who are doing everything possible and impossible to restore historical justice and our bright future.

On behalf of ‚ÄúTime of the First,‚Äù we want to express our gratitude to the VGA of the Kharkov region, which organized this meeting for us, and to the participant of the Northern Military District with the call sign ‚ÄúCossack‚Äù for being able to devote time to us and communicate with our youth movement. Thank you for protecting our peace and liberate our land! Low bow to every warrior who fights bravely at the front. We support you with all our hearts and are waiting for you at home with Victory! If any of you want to join us, write to our chat bot!@vremya_pervyh1_bot@vremya_pervyh1_bot@vremya_pervyh1_bot

translation:
Forwarded from: Steppe Gopher
"The Clash of Civilizations" by Samuel Huntington is a vivid example of a book that has not been read, but is condemned (or vice versa - they refer to it without reading it anyway, like Gumilev's books about passionarity). I've read it. Its essence is the proposal to replace the paradigm of the struggle between two ideological camps, which lost its meaning in 1991, and the unrealistic ‚Äúschool of realism‚Äù with a new paradigm for describing international relations, specifically suitable for the situation of the 1990s.

The author emphasized that this concept is not a dogma for all times, and over time it will be replaced by some other one. He especially paid attention, as an indicator of the relevance of the civilizational approach, to the relations between the two largest countries of the ‚ÄúOrthodox civilization‚Äù - Russia and Ukraine. As long as they have friendly relations, the paradigm he proposed works. If ‚Äúsecurity rivalry‚Äù and territorial disputes begin, it means that instead of cultural and religious community, ideological differences again come to the fore.

More precisely, now it is more correct to talk not about ideology in the classical form, but about differences in concepts, in political culture, because of which the ruling Russian Federation, Asabiya, finds a common language much more easily with the leadership of the PRC, the DPRK, Khomeinist Iran, Central Asian post-Soviet autocracies and even the Ottoman faction political class of Turkey, rather than with the elites of historically Orthodox countries: https://t.me/russ_orientalist/17089 In the last chapter (which, it seems, no one except me has read) Huntington focused on the problem of ‚Äúglobal barbarism‚Äù as the common enemy of all civilizations - and had the opportunity to live to see the rise of decolonial theory, BLM and Latin American drug cartels.

PS: At the same time, purely on the basis of demographic statistics, back in 1995 he predicted the Arab Spring and specifically the wars in Syria and Yemen - rarely can anyone boast of such a successful forecast for the future 20 years. Telegram Dimitriev On the map, population growth in Muslim countries, and decline in Christian countries. There is nothing unusual in this, but there is another stable pattern - Ro...VIEW MESSAGE

‚ÄúExperts from the German Society of Gastroenterology, Digestive and Metabolic Diseases say that Easter lamb, eggs and other foods can be easily avoided. Instead, it's best to look to healthier plant-based alternatives.
Physician and gastroenterologist Monica Rau notes that a plant-based diet reduces the risk of obesity and weight-related complications such as diabetes and cardiovascular disease.
Current research suggests that a healthy vegan diet is generally preferable to an unrestricted diet. It is known that the German Nutrition Society has already adjusted its recommendations for the consumption of animal products. Germany's leading food authorities now recommend consuming a maximum of 300 grams of meat (instead of 600 grams) and no more than one egg per week.
According to scientists, one egg per week is enough to provide the body with essential nutrients. By giving up excessive consumption of eggs, people will also reduce greenhouse gas emissions" https://t.me/dimsmirnov175/68013

translation:
Fake: Ukrainian saboteurs are operating in Ufa, and exploding banknotes are scattered throughout the city. You need to stock up on food, fire extinguishers and not write to anyone, because every message will now be read by the competent authorities. It‚Äôs good that this won‚Äôt last long, because the Internet and cellular communications will soon be turned off. A document with this content is being distributed in instant messengers. Truth: Of course, there are no saboteurs in Ufa. If civilians were in danger, the authorities would have said so long ago and taken appropriate measures. And such information would 100% appear not only in local, but also in federal media and Telegram channels.

Secondly, ‚Äúexploding bills‚Äù do not exist. We have already told you that ‚ÄúPetal‚Äù mines, fakes about which periodically appear on the Internet, cannot be disguised as a banknote. Moreover, such devices are not scattered manually.

Third, no ‚Äúnew communication rules‚Äù came into force on March 28th. Information about voice calls has been stored since 2017 and can be used by the Ministry of Internal Affairs, FSB, FSO, SVR and FSIN by court decision. However, WhatsApp is not included in the register of ‚Äúinformation distributors‚Äù and is not obliged to store correspondence and voice recordings.

Fourthly, there are no prerequisites for turning off mobile communications and the Internet on the territory of the Russian Federation. They have been scaring Russians with such fakes for many years.

Fifthly, the people whose signatures are placed under the document do not work either in the Ufa mayor‚Äôs office or in municipal institutions. Therefore, we urge everyone to remain calm and trust only trusted sources of information. Subscribe to the ‚ÄúWar on Fake News‚Äù to prevent yourself from being deceived.

translation:
Forwarded from: International fresh
The Ukrainian Armed Forces cannot resist Russian aerial bombs - Business Insider The American publication Business Insider reported that the Ukrainian Armed Forces cannot resist Russian glide bombs. The publication states that over the course of a week, Russian aviation dropped about 600 aerial bombs on Ukrainian positions. Airstrikes cause serious damage to the Ukrainian Armed Forces. Moreover, if the plane dropped an aerial bomb, then the Ukrainians are no longer able to shoot it down.

In such conditions, the Ukrainian Armed Forces are forced to transfer their air defense systems closer to the front line in order to try to attack Russian aircraft. However, this led to serious losses for the Ukrainian air defense, including the destruction of American Patriot air defense systems. In addition, the Ukrainian Armed Forces have very little ammunition left for air defense systems, which also makes Ukrainian troops defenseless against Russian air bombs. Business Insider Ukraine says Russia in less than a week hit it with 700 glide bombs, weapons tha...Devastating glide bombs have been a major threat to Ukraine's forces, and they can only be beaten by shooting down planes before they're released.

translation:
A meeting of deputies of the United Russia faction with the Chairman of the Government of the Russian Federation took place.
At the meeting with Mikhail Mishustin, key aspects of cooperation between the Government and United Russia were discussed. At the moment, a mechanism for systemic interaction has already been built, covering
Show more
various areas of activity, including the social sphere, economics, integration of new regions, as well as support for special operation participants and their families.
Mikhail Mishustin expressed gratitude to the party for its work on the budget, which was supplemented with articles important for citizens. Amendments to the budget exceeded 138 billion rubles and affected such aspects as the development of rural areas, the fight against cardiovascular diseases, education and science. We noted the role of United Russia in the work on the employment law.
Particular attention was paid to the initiatives of the party and the working group to support the participants in the special operation and their loved ones. During its work, more than 100 laws were adopted aimed at helping fighters.
United Russia also made significant proposals for the integration of new regions and the preparation of new national projects that will help strengthen the country's defense capability and develop professional personnel.
The main legislative priorities of the party are the instructions of the President included in the people's program, which are worked out with the participation of the Government.
The results of joint work, discussed during the meeting, demonstrate the importance of interaction between different levels of government and the party structure to ensure significant steps in the development of the country.
#UnitedRussia #Government

Thus began the occupation of part of the territory of Ukraine, which continues to this day.‚ñ™Ô∏èIn response, the West introduced political and economic sanctions against Russia. translation:
A visually impaired girl from Bryansk weaves tactical bracelets for the military
Despite serious vision problems (group I disabled), 22-year-old Bryansk student Anastasia Pivchulina mastered weaving tactical bracelets, or as they are also called, survival bracelets. This
Show more
such products are made from very strong paracord rope, which, if necessary, unravel very quickly and are used in the field for a variety of purposes.
Since the beginning of the special military operation, Anastasia was constantly thinking about how to help the soldiers at the front. Trench candles? Will not work. Weave camouflage nets? Traveling to where they weave is also not easy.
A chance helped: I met a girl on social networks who gave her the idea of bracelets and taught her how to make them. He says it‚Äôs not difficult, the main thing is to remember the hand movements.
#BehindUsTruth #WeDon‚Äôt Abandon Our Own

translation:
‚ö°Ô∏èPeter Sergeev: 45 years without 4 months - in the service of education in Lisichansk In 1924, at the age of 76, a respected teacher of the Lisichansk foreman school, where they trained ‚Äúmining masters for the coal region of Donetsk,‚Äù Pyotr Danilovich Sergeev began to work for a pension. and retirement. His work in this educational institution began immediately after the release of the order of the head of the Lugansk mining district Stanislav Podymovsky dated January 1, 1880 on his appointment as a mathematics teacher. In addition to the main course, Sergeev also had to read the Law of God.

The teacher was recognized for his work. He had the Order of Stanislav IV degree and Anna III degree, the rank of titular councilor. The young Soviet government did not offend him either. In 1922, during the celebrations of the 50th anniversary of the school (by this time - the technical school), Sergeev received a valuable gift from the district executive committee and the party committee of the Communist Party of Ukraine (Bolsheviks), and in 1924 a petition was submitted to be awarded the Order of the Red Banner of Labor.

Petr Danilovich was originally from Olshanka, Kursk province, studied for a year at St. Petersburg Imperial University, and in 1874 in Kharkov he mastered the 2nd course in the department of mathematical sciences and received the right to teach in secondary educational institutions

Sergeev‚Äôs name appeared in leading specialized magazines. True, not entirely due to the specifics of his work activity. The note described that on June 3, a 2nd grade student Zheltkevich, offended by the school manager Salzgeber for wearing a velvet band, bought a revolver at the market and, confusing the offender with Sergeev, shot him. But then the teacher survived.

Died of lung disease on November 9, 1924. He was buried with great honor near the walls of the very school where he went to teach future mining masters for so many years. Vyacheslav Yakovenko (‚ÄúKerch‚Äù)‚§µÔ∏è‚§µÔ∏è‚§µÔ∏è

Russian Defense Ministry: Three Ukrainian UAVs were destroyed by air defense systems over the territory of the Yaroslavl region.

The southern point of the Yaroslavl region is the vicinity of the city of Pereslavl-Zalessky. The shortest distance from it to the Ukrainian border is 640 km in a straight line.

Taking into account the fact that the Ukrainians had to bypass the Moscow-Tula air defense region, the distance can be increased by another 100 km (up to 740-750 km).

The Yaroslavl Motor Plant (YMZ) or the Yaroslavnefteorgsintez Oil Refinery (YANOS) seem to be a likely target - taking into account the bypass of air defense, the distance is up to 800 km.

That is, the crests do not calm down, and our educational work, coupled with the ‚Äúexhortations‚Äù of the Pindos, does not give the desired effect.
More convincing arguments are needed.

We pay students 9,000,000 rubles for bold ideas. Every year we select the 30 best students - participants in the Alpha Chance program. And we pay each 300,000 rubles for research, startups and development.

Talented kids from all over the country, like these three students, can get money. Karina Smirnova is a future teacher from Samara. She trains dogs to help special children. Thanks to the grant, he will become a professional dog handler. Bulat Minullin, a musician with visual impairments, teaches music reading for visually impaired children in Kazan. translation:
Forwarded from: Assault of the Deep
March 31, 1948 - By Decree of the Council of Ministers of the USSR No. 3679ss and in pursuance of it by order of the Ministry of Shipbuilding Industry No. 00164 dated April 7, 1948, a special design bureau No. 143 (SKB-143) was organized as part of the V Main Directorate of SMEs.

In the spring of 1948, SKB-143 was created in Leningrad to design high-speed submarines with new types of power plants.
The following year, TsKB-16 was formed, specializing in the development of heavy cruisers and after 4 years it was also repurposed for the development of submarines (in 1966 it was renamed TsPB Volna).
February 23, 1974 - by order of the Minister of Shipbuilding Industry, SPMBM and TsPB "Volna" were merged into the Union Design and Installation Bureau of Mechanical Engineering "Malachite".

Photo from the official website of JSC "SPMBM "MALAKHIT"

Dear Malachite residents and veterans of the bureau, congratulations on the Holiday! Thanks for the ships!

translation:
Pay 50 rubles and your city will become better: more than 25 regions of Russia have already applied for the introduction of a resort tax - from each tourist, depending on the city, they want to charge up to 100 rubles for a vacation. The money will be used exclusively for improvement and infrastructure development, Chairman of the State Duma for Tourism Sangadzhi Tarbaev told Zvezda.
 
‚ÄúThis experiment has been going on for three years; it was extended in 2024. The idea of the resort fee is for the ‚Äúcolored‚Äù money to remain in the city municipality, that is, it cannot be spent on anything other than the development of tourist infrastructure - stairs, ramps, fountains, decorations, and so on,‚Äù he noted.
 
Each region sets its own fee amount; it usually varies from ten to 50 rubles. However, in St. Petersburg, where the experiment will begin on April 1, each adult tourist will be charged 100 rubles per day of stay in a hotel or hostel - in large cities this amount is acceptable, the deputy added.

translation:
03/31/24. Relevant.
"
The first assault drone attack in history.
In Berdychi, which is now being liberated by Russian troops, field testing of a new promising Russian robotic
Show more
platforms.
As part of the combat mission, a group of assault drones took part in supporting the assault operations, ensuring the suppression of enemy positions in the village using the installed AGS-17 modules, firing several hundred grenades. During combat use, drones showed good results. The drones were able to continue operating even in conditions where losses of personnel and expensive equipment from enemy fire would have been inevitable.
The experience gained in combat use will be taken into account in the further production and development of assault robotic platforms. The combat use of such drones in Berdychi is actually similar to the first tank attack during the First World War.
A successful tracked base has great potential for developing a robotic platform for assault (installation of various combat modules) and support operations (transportation and installation of mines, removal of the wounded, transportation of cargo and equipment).
In the future, such platforms will take their place on the battlefield. Despite the fact that there are similar developments in the USA, Britain and China, it was Russia that was the first to use a group of assault drones in a real war.
The future has already arrived.
The project is being implemented with the support of Boris Rozhin ‚ÄúColonelcassad‚Äù and Chingis Dambiev ‚ÄúDambiev‚Äù.

translation:
Forwarded from: Panzerwaffle
Russian ground drones with AGS-17 have caused a lot of excitement. The crests got involved and released a video of a UAV attack on our microtanks. However, as you know, the main sign that a crest is lying is that he is breathing.

Here it is now, sorry for the uneven handwriting.

In this video, signs of rough editing and gluing in ‚Äúour favor‚Äù are noticed, so we‚Äôll deal with the Hochliwood:

1) The first UAV explodes over land drone No. 6 (hereinafter referred to as drone-s), to no avail. Then there is a cut, then we are shown an attack on drone number 3. No. 6 ‚Äì intact. Then again No. 6, but there is already a dent on his left screen. The crests probably tried to hit him several more times, but failed again. And only then the Ukrainian FPV explodes over No. 6, but it is again structurally intact.

2) Now consider these two frames before and after the explosion of drone No. 3. The corpse is in place, the log hasn‚Äôt even moved (this is due to such and such an explosion!), there is no crater. But drone No. 3 inexplicably disappeared from the frame, along with a piece of iron under its caterpillar. We have seen everything, but not such tricks with disappearances - Copperfildenko is crying in a trench and smoking nervously. Or the explosion is very strong, and then everything around moves, motherfucker of physics. Or someone played with the picture.

3) There is not only a drone war, but also an assembly-neural network war. From the Ukrainian side, a lot of videos with clever editing are being uploaded, neural networks and specialized software are being used with all their might. And the worse things are for the Ukrainian Armed Forces at the front, the more beautiful their videos are.

In general, don‚Äôt be fooled by the video from your opponent, don‚Äôt rush to tear your hair out everywhere and shout urgently. This is exactly the effect that dillpsycorps expects from you. #slavarobotam#psyops
description: The Telegram channel of Russian blogger Alexey Sukonkin.
name: A_S_Sukonkin

translation:
03/31/24. Relevant.
‚ÄúKyiv will lose Odessa and access to the Black Sea if the war drags on‚Äù: Elon Musk wrote a long text about the war in Ukraine
"Ukraine has tragically wasted the lives of soldiers by attacking more
Show more
a large army with deeply layered defenses, minefields and more powerful artillery, while lacking armored vehicles and lacking air superiority! Any fool could have predicted this.
A year ago, I advised Ukraine to strengthen itself and devote all resources to defense, because even in this case it would be difficult to hold the ground without strong landscape barriers.
Russia has no chance of taking over all of Ukraine, since popular resistance in the west of the country will be fierce - but Russia will certainly take over more territory than it does now.
The longer the war continues, the more territory Russia will gain until it reaches the Dnieper, which is difficult to overcome. However, if the war lasts long enough, Odessa will fall.
In my opinion, the main question is whether Ukraine will lose all access to the Black Sea or not. I recommend that the issue be resolved through negotiations before it comes to that."

translation:
Summary of the Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation on the progress of the special military operation¬†(as of March 31, 2024) Main points:

 The Russian Aerospace Forces carried out a group strike with high-precision weapons on energy infrastructure facilities and the gas production industry of Ukraine.

As a result of the strike, the work of defense industry enterprises producing and repairing weapons, military equipment and ammunition was disrupted. All strike targets achieved. Designated targets are hit.

Three Su-25 aircraft of the Ukrainian Armed Forces were destroyed at the Voznesensk airfield in the Nikolaev region.

‚Äî The Russian Armed Forces in the Kupyansk direction repelled five counterattacks by assault groups of Ukrainian Armed Forces brigades near Sinkovka and Ternov;

‚Äî In the Kherson direction, the losses of the Ukrainian Armed Forces amounted to up to 50 military personnel, three vehicles, a US-made M777 howitzer, an Akatsiya self-propelled artillery mount and a D-20 gun

‚Äî In the South Donetsk direction, enemy losses amounted to up to 85 military personnel, two tanks, five vehicles, two howitzers: M777 and M198 made in the USA

‚Äî The Russian Armed Forces in the Donetsk direction occupied more advantageous positions, the Armed Forces of Ukraine lost more than 300 servicemen;

‚Äî The air defense of the Russian Armed Forces shot down 178 Ukrainian UAVs, as well as 23 rockets from the HIMARS and Uragan multiple launch rocket systems in one day.

Over the past 24 hours, air defense systems have shot down 178 Ukrainian unmanned aerial vehicles, as well as 23 rockets from the HIMARS and Uragan multiple launch rocket systems. In total, since the start of the special military operation, the following have been destroyed: 580 aircraft, 270 helicopters, 17,951 unmanned aerial vehicles, 492 anti-aircraft missile systems, 15,650 tanks and other armored combat vehicles, 1,258 combat vehicles of multiple launch rocket systems, 8,594 field artillery guns and mortars, as well as 20,433 units of special military vehicles.

Read in full: |part1|part2|

translation:
üá∫üá¶It has become known that Ukrainian refugees, as well as Ukrainians living abroad before the start of the SVO, must submit income declarations to the State Tax Service of Ukraine before May 1, including those received abroad. It is reported that the exchange of information to control payment taxes will take place between Ukraine and 110 foreign tax administrations.

Pensioners must also declare their income, including social assistance. Despite the fact that assistance is not taxed, Ukrainians are still required to declare it, otherwise a fine of 340 hryvnia.

Of course, this caused a storm of indignation among Ukrainians who had been living in Europe long before the start of the conflict. They ask a logical question: why on earth should they pay taxes to Ukraine if they have been living abroad for a long time?

The reaction in the comments is priceless, writes Ukropsky Fresh.

translation:
Forwarded from: Reflections of Tatarsky
The project ‚ÄúAn Almanac of Contemporary Prose and Journalism named after Maxim Fomin (Vladlen Tatarsky)‚Äù introduces you to another contestant for the award of the same name, Vladimir Agranovich. In the previous post, we introduced you to journalist Dmitry Grigoriev. #nominees_award_MaximaFominaNomination: ‚ÄúFiction‚Äù
The story ‚ÄúNicknamed Sailor.‚Äù Vladimir Agranovich
About the author: Vladimir Agranovich gained quite wide popularity as the author of the documentary film ‚ÄúDonbass. Recognized". The film was highly appreciated by the audience and won the ‚ÄúHeroes of a Big Country‚Äù festival in the ‚ÄúBest Documentary Project‚Äù category. In April 2023, Vladimir, together with his sister Ekaterina (widely known to the telegram community as ‚ÄúKatrusya‚Äù), filmed and released the first feature series dedicated to a special military operation, ‚ÄúMobilization.‚Äù Now the contestant is working on a continuation of this series, scheduled for release in 2024 under the title ‚ÄúReservists.‚Äù About the work:
Vladimir wrote the book ‚ÄúNicknamed Sailor‚Äù for almost five years, from 2015 to 2019. It is based on observations collected by the author during this time ‚Äúfrom nature‚Äù, from inside the events, and is dedicated to the people who stood up to defend their Motherland in 2014: Donbass militias, Vladimir‚Äôs father, his godfather and many others ‚Äì their destinies, experiences, difficult life decisions.# almanac_Vladlena#MaximaFomin Prize

translation:
Forwarded from: Military chronicle
There is one important feature in strikes on the energy sector in Ukraine.üî∫After each combined strike by the Aerospace Forces, the Ukrainian side lays out a cruise missile flight map, from which several important conclusions can be drawn.

Firstly, a significant part of the Geran-2 drones, as before, is still launched from the southern section, just like a year ago. The launches are massive - from 30 to 70 UAVs are used in one raid. The Ukrainian side cannot stop these attacks. The only thing that remains is to fight drones in the air, but every month, due to thinning air defense and the growth of drone production, this is becoming increasingly difficult.

Secondly, information about the flights of cruise missiles and even the detailed routes of their deceptive maneuvers are tracked not only by the Ukrainian military, but also by the entire air/electronic reconnaissance of NATO forces, into which the Ukrainian air defense system has been quite tightly integrated almost since the beginning of the Northern Military District. However, nothing can still be done with the vast majority of X-101/X-555 missiles. Of course, there are isolated cases of missiles being hit, and some fail in flight, but their number is negligible compared to the breaking through X-101s and fits into the order to hit targets.

Thirdly, apparently, the air defense of the Sumy, Zhytomyr, Rivne, Ternopil and Khmelnytsky regions, not to mention Lviv and especially the central region with Kiev, operate with significant restrictions. With each missile strike, the Kh-101s enter from a predetermined direction, fly over several areas, circle for some time in Ukrainian airspace and then hit targets. Western Patriot/NASAMS/SAMP-T air defense systems are either not activated at all or are activated in the most critical situation.

Understanding the flight routes of cruise missiles does not help the Ukrainian side in any way in this regard. Rather, this benefits Russian intelligence, which is likely to monitor all activity regarding reports of strikes. @MChroniclesBot - send your photos and videos from the front. Subscribe to Military ChronicleMilitary Chronicle on VK

translation:
‚ÄúHunger, want and suffering in Rafah. Children eat grass, rats or animal food": The German Tagesspiegel published a report about children in the Gaza Strip - illness, hunger and constant risk of death.

‚ÄúMany children walk around the city restlessly, they lack security and care. They are literally trapped here. The number of people suffering from hunger has more than doubled since December.
People, including children, eat grass, rats or animal food. There is very little food left in the south and it is extremely expensive. Children are already dying from malnutrition or dehydration.
There has been a food shortage for several months. At the same time, many of the minors were left without adults. You can often see children who are forced to take care of the same children. We don't know where their families are because so many people were killed. In particular, 13,700 children were killed. And although bombs kill children, they are not the only threat: disease, dehydration and malnutrition also pose dangers. Some children survive the rocket attacks, but have nothing to eat and are at risk of dehydration. They also die from diarrhea and vomiting. We have no idea how many diseases are circulating here. Doctors in makeshift tent clinics are unable to make a diagnosis, and the number of premature births is terribly high. Pregnant women are so stressed that they give birth too early and many babies end up in incubators. And doctors have to decide: what to do if a newborn needs help? Should I send the more developed child home? The doctor told us that being sent home actually means death."

translation:
Meanwhile, Comet Pons-Brooks, which approaches Earth once every seven decades, can already be seen in the night sky.

The best places to observe the comet are in southern Russia, Crimea and the Caucasus.

Comet Pons-Brooks is a fairly faint object. It is visible low above the horizon, approximately at the same level as Jupiter.

It is a short-period Halley-type comet with an orbital period of 71 years. Moreover, as a celestial body, the comet is simply huge - only the diameter of its core is 17 km.

However, the distance from the comet to the Earth is about 230 million km, so it flies far and does not pose a danger.

The next time this comet will be close to Earth will be in 2095.

translation:
Forwarded from: Anton Alikhanov. Kaliningrad
The presidential national project ‚ÄúHousing and Urban Environment‚Äù improves the quality of life in the municipalities of the Kaliningrad region.üîëIn the village of Lyublino, Svetlovsky district, 11 families who lived in dilapidated buildings received the keys to new apartments with a clean finish and gas.üè°This year, the region continues to accelerate completion of the program for relocation from dilapidated housing. Instead of September 1, 2025, it is planned to be completed a year earlier. In total, from 2019 to the present day, housing conditions have improved for more than 2.7 thousand residents of the emergency fund. Public and courtyard areas in Svetly are being transformed. A comprehensive improvement of seven public areas and ten courtyards was completed. This amount of work became possible, among other things, thanks to the active participation of residents in online voting on the selection of objects.üìçI remind you that residents can determine the places that will be improved in 2025. Voting is taking place on the platform until April 30 of this year.‚úÖThe region is successfully implementing the activities of the federal project ‚ÄúFormation of a Comfortable Urban Environment,‚Äù which was initiated by Russian President Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin. From 2019 to 2023, with the involvement of federal funds, 176 courtyards and 79 public areas were landscaped in municipalities of the Kaliningrad region.#we are working

translation:
As the Cheka-OGPU learned, during a search of crypto exchangers in Moscow City in connection with the investigation of the terrorist attack in Crocus City Hall, the attention of operatives was attracted by a client recorded as ‚ÄúYulik London‚Äù. The cash was delivered to Moscow City for him, went in crypto to the specified wallet, and then part of this money ended up with terrorists. It is clear that Yulik might not have anything to do with the financing of terrorism, but the operatives were hooked. It became clear who ‚ÄúYulik London‚Äù was very quickly. This is Yuliy Kaloev.

The latter was Chairman of the Board of Directors at OJSC Kaluga Meat Processing Plant (KMK). From 2008 to 2012, Kaloev attracted loans and at the same time transferred the plant‚Äôs assets to organizations controlled by him, registered in Cyprus. In this bank alone, the enterprising director managed to borrow about 760 million rubles. When a criminal case was opened, Kaloev fled to England. He is on the international wanted list. He chose London not by chance. His wife, Nadezhda Stasiuk, then worked in the office of the investment bank VTB Capital in London. At the time of the crime, Ms. Stasiuk headed the Legal Department, and then Nadezhda Ippolitovna rose to the position of Executive Director of VTB Capital, London.
When the war began, VTU came under sanctions and was forced to close its ‚Äúshops‚Äù around the world. Stasiuk began to help her husband in his activities‚Ä¶.

As a result, it turns out that the terrorists received money from the family of the ex-top manager of VTB, through an exchanger belonging to Yanukovych‚Äôs ‚Äúwallet‚Äù. It‚Äôs difficult to even say what kind of trail is worth looking for here.... https://t.me/vchkogpu/47131TelegramVChK-OGPU Yesterday the FSB stormed the Beribit crypto exchange. The event was related to the investigation of the terrorist attack at Crocus City Hall. According to sources of the Cheka-OGPU, of course...0:11Ó¶õVIEW MESSAGE

translation:
Colleagues sent a video of an attack by UAVs on the Yaroslavl oil refinery. I won‚Äôt post the full video, but the point is not in the video, but in what is happening. So, judging by what I saw in this video, two conclusions can be drawn.
Firstly, in terms of anti-aircraft protection and defense of the Yaroslavl Oil Refinery was not carried out. They tried to shoot down the Ukrainian UAV using small arms and, judging by the sounds of the shots, they tried to shoot it down with civilian variants of the Kalashnikov, since the shooting was carried out in single shots and not in bursts. No ZU-22 or Shilok, which would have shot down this Ukrainian UAV at once, was used there...
Secondly, when approaching the target, the Ukrainian UAV maneuvered and attempted to escape fire from the ground. This tells us that this UAV was remotely controlled and visually monitored by the enemy.
In general, we continue to observe, on the one hand, the reluctance of owners of energy infrastructure enterprises to invest in ensuring the safety of their property, and on the other hand, absolute negligence on the ground, on the part of law enforcement agencies and local authorities.

translation:
Forwarded from: Military Department of the Moscow Patriarchate
PRIESTHOOD AND MILITARY On the 2nd Sunday of Lent in 1111, as the Ipatiev Chronicle reports, the combined forces of Prince Vladimir Monomakh and Svyatoslav Izyaslavich, during a campaign on the Don, defeated the Polovtsian troops of Khan Sharukan. This event went down in the history of our country as the Battle of Salnitsa. The chronicle mentions that our troops were accompanied by priests who walked ahead of the army with chants and a cross in their hands. It is noteworthy that the priests not only accompanied the soldiers on the campaign, but stayed with the Russian troops on the battlefield until their return, which means they can confidently be called military priests.

The written source serves as proof that at all times the Church and the army, the military and the priesthood are the support and foundation of our state. Throughout the thousand-year history of our Fatherland, the military priesthood has been the oldest church-state institution and the most important link that connects the military and the Church.

The presence of priests in the ranks of our army over the centuries has become one of the key factors in increasing the spiritual and moral component of the Russian army.

Author of the illustration: Vladislav Bamov. Military Department of the Moscow Patriarchate

translation:
Forwarded from: Office of the President
"When our soldiers expelled Russia from Buchi, from Irpen, from Borodyanka, from the entire Kyiv region, and then from Sumy region, from Chernihiv region - everyone could see that these were victories not only of Ukrainian courage and weapons, but also of human morality.

Ukrainians then began to return to normal life wherever Russia had brought death and abuse, looting and sadism.

And our people killed by the occupiers, whose bodies lay on the streets of Buchi, were a testimony that no one in the world can stay away from this battle. Because it is here, in Ukraine, protecting our people, our lives, our state, that humanity wins.

In order to launch such aggressions against others, Russia first destroyed its own morality and made violence and hatred its ideology. Such systems do not stop just like that. The force stops them. Unity stops them. Determination and understanding - exactly what they want to destroy.

I am proud of everyone who dedicates his life to the preservation of the life of all of Ukraine. I thank everyone in the world who helps us."

Participation of Volodymyr Zelenskyi in events on the occasion of the second anniversary of the liberation of Kyiv region.

translation:
US Congressman Tim Walberg called for resolving the conflict in Ukraine and Gaza with nuclear strikes.

‚ÄúWhy are we spending our money to build a port for them?

Because Joe Biden is convinced that we must deliver humanitarian aid to Gaza. And I don't think we should. I don't think it should be any part of our aid that goes to Israel, to support our greatest ally, probably in the entire world, to defeat Hamas, Iran, Russia, and possibly North Korea, and more China who help Hamas.
We should not spend a single cent on humanitarian aid. It should be like Nagasaki and Hiroshima. Get this over with quickly. The same should happen in Ukraine. Defeat Putin quickly. Instead of spending 80% of our funding to Ukraine on humanitarian causes, we should spend 100% on driving out Russian forces if that is our goal."

translation:
Ukrainian agent involved in strikes on Lugansk detained in LPR - FSB
A citizen of the Outskirts, involved in attacks on Lugansk in May 2023 with Storm Shadow missiles, was detained in the LPR.
Show more
The scumbag, guided by personal motives, in order to assist Ukrainian terrorists, collected and transferred information to SBU officers about the locations of personnel and military equipment of the Russian Armed Forces involved in a special military operation.
The detainee said that he began to cooperate with the SBU through a Telegram bot. According to him, the SBU officer set the task of conducting reconnaissance of the territory of the former Polipak plant in Lugansk.
A criminal case has been opened against the detainee under an article for espionage, and an investigation is underway.
Let us recall that on May 12, 2023, the Ukrainian Armed Forces attacked the Polypak polymer products enterprise with Storm Shadow cruise missiles, and a fire occurred.
As a result of the shelling, six children were injured.

translation:
Forwarded from: IZ.RU
The secret of active longevity lies not only in genetics and the level of physical activity. You can prolong the youth of your body with the help of certain nutrition.

Brand chef of the Warm Conversations network of boarding houses for the elderly, Tamara Moseva, shared with Izvestia a list of products that will help maintain youth: Spinach, cabbage and broccoli, which contain vitamin K and folic acid - help maintain healthy bones and heart; Black currant , plums and cherries contain anthocyanins, which protect cells from damage and also strengthen the cardiovascular system; Peas, beans, lentils, chickpeas are rich in protein, iron, calcium, and amino acids, thanks to which the level of cholesterol in the blood decreases, improves liver function; Nuts, avocados, red fish, olive oil will help support the health of the brain, nervous system and heart; Wheat, rice, oats, barley will provide the body with energy.

Moseva notes that it is worth controlling your salt intake, and also remembering to drink enough water. Subscribe to IZ.RU

‚ÄúWine moms‚Äù who drink one glass a day are 45% more likely to develop cardiovascular diseases‚Äù: It has been proven that alcohol is even more harmful for women than for men.

Drinking a glass of wine every night can increase a woman's risk of fatal heart disease by 45%, say the authors of a new study. Women who drink at least three glasses of wine a day for three months have a 68% higher risk of developing cardiovascular disease than those who drink alcohol several times a week.
Scientists note that the risks for women with regular alcohol consumption are noticeably greater than for men: in particular, men who drink the equivalent of a glass of wine have an increased risk of developing cardiovascular disease by only 33%, which is 12% lower than in women.
These differences are attributed to hormonal differences between the sexes, which affect how the body processes alcohol."

translation:
Arab AfricaPhoto,üá™üá¨üá∫üá≥Egypt will receive the first tranche of an IMF loan next week

Prime Minister of Egypt Mustaf...üá™üá¨üá¨üáßüá´üá∑Egypt began to forget the mistakes of the colonial era. The enslavement of the country in the 19th century followed approximately the same scenario.‚úçÔ∏èCairo began to receive its first loans from European banks back in 1833, during the reign of Muhammad Ali, but by 1840 Egypt‚Äôs debt was already 80 million francs. At the same time, tens of thousands of foreigners began to populate the country. By 1863, the external debt had risen to 367 million francs. Mostly it was associated with the huge costs of building the Suez Canal, but other prestigious projects, including the luxurious palaces of the Egyptian rulers, required a lot of money. The growth of debt was also facilitated by dishonest speculation by European intermediaries, moneylenders, bankers, etc.

In 1876, the country officially declared its financial insolvency, and the control of creditor powers was established over it, which raised a whole wave of patriotic movements under the slogan ‚ÄúEgypt for Egyptians.‚Äù Khedive Ismail, who resisted the powers, was replaced by Tawfik (1879 - 1892), who obeyed the British in everything. During his period, the patriotic movement of officers led by Colonel Ahmed Orabi was crushed as a result of the war with the British in 1882, which marked the beginning of the British occupation of Egypt.

Despite the fact that Egypt formally emerged from the First World War as a free state, it was ruled by pro-British kings, and the Suez Canal remained a completely Franco-British (later British) enterprise. England controlled navigation through it until 1956, when President Gamal Abdel Nasser announced the nationalization of the canal, risking an outbreak of armed conflict. This led to the invasion of British, French and Israeli troops and the start of the week-long Suez War. The country was then saved from full-scale hostilities by the intervention of the USSR, led by Khrushchev, who threatened to launch thermonuclear strikes on the territories of the invading countries. The world through the eyes of an Arabist

Two years have already passed since these days our soldiers, all our people expelled the Russian invaders from the Kyiv region. Borodyanka, Bucha, Irpin, Gostomel, Moschun were places of battles, places of struggle of Ukrainians for their country, for their lives, for their home, free from evil.

Today we honor the strength of each and every one who stood then, is now fighting, working and will definitely bring freedom to our entire land, to every town and village of Ukraine, which Russia wants to appropriate, but which it will have to give back - to the Ukrainians. I thank everyone who helps! Thank you to everyone who is with Ukraine and in Ukraine! Thanks to our soldiers! I am proud of our people!
Glory to Ukraine!

description: Meduza is an online Russian news source that is currently in exile in Latvia. It used to be headed by Galina Timchenko, who was the editor-in-chief for Lenta.ru from 2004 to 2014. However, she was fired in 2014 and replaced by the pro-Putin Aleksei Goreslavsky, who has since left to work in the Kremlin. Following her dismissal, Timchenko created Meduza as an aggregator of handpicked Russian-language news. Over the years, Meduza has suffered a series of controversies, and while it is an anti-Kremlin outlet, it is known to post occasional eyebrow-raising content. It is blocked in Russia.
name: meduzalive

translation:
#HPE_cognitive
If anyone suddenly didn‚Äôt know what yellow news is, from yellow newspapers)
According to one of the popular versions, it was thanks to The Yellow Kid that the term ‚Äúyellow press‚Äù appeared.
Show more
The Yellow Kid was the world's first color comic strip, published from 1895 to 1898 in The New York World and then in the New York Journal American. The comic is a satirical sketch about a simple kid from the slums. Its author was Richard Outcolt, and the main highlight was the ambiguous remarks of the characters, built on wordplay and provocative subtext.
It is believed that it was the war over the rights to The Yellow Kid between the publishers of The New York World and the New York Journal American that changed the very principle of journalistic work. In pursuit of the attention of the mass reader, publications used scandalous and shocking materials, gossip and rumors. At the instigation of the editor-in-chief of the New York Press, the style of both newspapers received the title of ‚Äúyellow baby journalism,‚Äù and over time it was shortened to yellow journalism or the yellow press.

translation:
Forwarded from: Zhanna Valevskaya
It is because ‚Äúit doesn‚Äôt concern me what happens there, I‚Äôm here,‚Äù the coup in Kyiv was carried out by less than 5% of the population.

The rest were sitting at home, because ‚Äúwell, it‚Äôs there, somewhere.‚Äù The most significant thing is that all these people who were sitting at home during the Maidan events, all these people who were sitting at home during the events of May 2, all these people who sat at home after their own fellow citizens were burned alive in their hometown, and the new government did not take any measures in connection with what happened... These people sat at home all this time. Because it didn‚Äôt concern them personally.

And when it began to affect them personally, they already began to somehow react to what was happening.

For example, in Odessa, when the explosion of the SBU building caused glass to fly out in some citizens‚Äô houses, people who had previously sat at home and did not interfere in anything began to react to what was happening. They went to the Ukronazi court, which tried the organizers and perpetrators of sabotage actions in Odessa directed against the Ukronazis, and brought statements demanding that the Odessa underground fighters compensate them for the damage caused.

They came hiding their eyes on the floor.

Hiding their eyes from the Odessa underground fighters, who were tried by the Ukronazi court, which turned a blind eye to the Nazi thugs present in the courtroom, who did not hesitate to shout to anyone: ‚ÄúWe burned you on May 2 in the House of Trade Unions. We destroy all of your people in Donbass. We destroyed you, we are destroying you, and we will destroy you until we kill you all. We will burn and torture your wives, mothers and children. So live and be afraid.‚Äù They came with their statements to the Ukronazi court, hiding their eyes from their fellow citizens, elderly women and men, many of whom suffered from the events of May 2 and who came to support the Odessa underground fighters, collected food and food for them, and donated letters, etc. etc.., supported their comrades despite the problems with the SBU, despite the threats and beatings of the Ukronazis.

They came with their statements to demand protection from the Ukronazi court, hiding their eyes from all those who did not and never recognized the legitimacy of the Ukronazi government and the Ukronazi court.

But these people recognized this power. They demanded that this government restore order in the city and protect their personal interests.

They did not demand that this government investigate the crime of May 2 and punish the organizers and perpetrators of the massacre of Odessa residents in the House of Trade Unions. Because it doesn‚Äôt concern them personally. But they demanded that this government punish those who fought against the perpetrators of this massacre...

These people acted in the image and likeness of the very women who threw stones at the ‚Äúhouse arsonist‚Äù Zoya Kosmodemyanskaya when she was being led to execution. Same modus operandi.

All these people, whether on our side or on that side, are people who are never affected by anything until it affects them personally, in general they always act in the image and likeness of such women. Simply because all they want is to live a normal life and not be personally touched. That's all.

And this is exactly the position of citizens, both on one side and the other, caring only about their own, personal interests, willingness to put up with anything, as long as it doesn‚Äôt concern me in any way, this is such indifference and indifference, to the fact that is happening around, and has become one of the main reasons for this war...

Because yes. It's a shame. You can‚Äôt say anything else here.‚òëÔ∏èZhanna_ValevskayaTelegram through my eyes Because ‚Äúit doesn‚Äôt concern me what happens there, I‚Äôm here,‚Äù the coup in Kyiv was carried out by less than 5% of the population.

The rest...1:51Ó¶õVIEW MESSAGE

translation:
‚ÄãDozens of powerful strikes on Ukraineüá∑üá∫üá∫üá¶According to the Ministry of Defense, from March 23 to March 30, the Russian Armed Forces carried out 1 large-scale and 57 powerful group strikes with missiles and kamikaze UAVs on targets in Ukraine.

As a result, military-industrial complex enterprises, decision-making centers, various warehouses, air defense systems, enemy military deployment points and energy industry facilities were hit.

4 MLRS, 5 P-18 radar units, 3 counter-battery counter stations and 18 electronic warfare stations were destroyed.

Fighter aircraft and air defense systems shot down 11 Storm Shadow/SCALP-EG missiles, 3 Neptune anti-ship missiles, 4 ADM-160 MALD missiles, 2 adapted S-200 missiles, 2 Hammer bombs, 171 rockets for MLRS and 1208 enemy UAVs.üí• The situation on the fronts‚óÄÔ∏èThe Russian Armed Forces were defeated in the Kupyansky direction. 11 counterattacks by assault groups of five brigades of the Ukrainian Armed Forces were successfully repelled. The enemy lost more than 310 military personnel killed and wounded, 2 tanks, 3 armored fighting vehicles, 22 vehicles, 19 howitzers and 1 Caesar self-propelled gun.‚óÄÔ∏èIn the Donetsk direction, units of the Russian Armed Forces improved their position near the village of Krasnoye in the DPR. 12 enemy counterattacks were successfully repulsed. As a result, the enemy lost over 2,360 military personnel, 5 tanks, 16 armored fighting vehicles, 61 vehicles and 23 howitzers.‚óÄÔ∏èIn the Avdeevsky direction, units of the Russian Armed Forces continued to actively move deeper into enemy lines, occupying more advantageous positions. The personnel and equipment of 8 enemy brigades were hit by fire, and 64 counterattacks were repelled. As a result, the enemy lost more than 1,870 military personnel, 13 tanks, 20 armored fighting vehicles, 50 vehicles, 30 howitzers, 1 M109 Paladin self-propelled gun, 1 Panzerhaubitze 2000 self-propelled gun and 1 BM-21 Grad MLRS.‚óÄÔ∏èIn the South Donetsk direction, units of the Russian Armed Forces improved their tactical situation, and also inflicted fire defeat on 7 enemy brigades in the Zaporozhye region and the DPR. Five counterattacks by assault groups of three enemy brigades were successfully repulsed. Enemy losses exceeded 860 military personnel, 4 armored fighting vehicles, 35 vehicles, 5 howitzers and 2 Krab self-propelled guns.‚óÄÔ∏èIn the Kherson direction, units of the Russian Armed Forces inflicted fire on the personnel and equipment of 8 enemy brigades in the Zaporozhye and Kherson regions. Enemy losses exceeded 370 military personnel, 2 tanks, 7 armored fighting vehicles, 29 vehicles and 13 howitzers.

As a result of the anti-aircraft battle, 18 aerial targets were destroyed: 9 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles and 9 Shahed-136/131 attack UAVs.

Thank you to the defenders of the sky for the combat work! Together - to victory!

translation:
They served together, died together: the second anniversary of the death of servicemen from Lysychansk Maksym Vashchuk and Anton Izhevatkin

Military servicemen served in the Luhansk Zonal Department of the Military Law and Order Service.

Maxim and Anton come from the same city, joined the service together - in 2015 they joined the Armed Forces of Ukraine. They took a direct part in the operation of the United Forces to ensure national security and defense in the territory of Donetsk and Luhansk regions.

3 on the first day of the full-scale invasion of the enemy, together with fellow soldiers, they stood up for the defense of their native Luhansk region.

On March 31, 2022, Senior Sergeant Vashchuk and Sergeant Inzhevatkin died heroically during a combat mission near Popasnaya.

By decree of the President of Ukraine, both were awarded the Order of Courage III degree (posthumously).

Deep condolences to the relatives and friends of the fallen defenders. Eternal memory to Heroes!üïØÔ∏è@memorial_ukraine

The daughter of a Russian volunteer who fought in the Republika Srpska in the 90s, helped people escape in Crocus Hall during the terrorist attack on March 22, 2024. Alexandra is from a Russian large family. Sasha has one younger sister and four older brothers. And they have wonderful parents:
Alexander Alexandrovich Kravchenko - Russian volunteer (since 1992, the youngest volunteer of the Second Russian Volunteer Detachment of the Republika Srpska); war invalid (wounded three times: survived two serious wounds); Since 2000, he has returned to Russia and is actively involved in educating children and youth, creating one of the first associations of military-patriotic clubs in modern Russia, ‚ÄúStyag‚Äù; collects and preserves Russian and Cossack culture, and at the Church of the Nativity in Mitino (Moscow) created and develops the ethno-cultural center ‚ÄúRozhdestvensky Kuren‚Äù; from the first days of the Russian Spring in Crimea and the resistance of 2014 in Donbass, he has been actively involved in the collection and delivery of humanitarian aid to the front.
Tatyana Evgenievna Kravchenko is a mother of six children, a sister of mercy, a teacher in caring for the seriously ill and wounded at the Training Center of the St. Alexius Hospital, regularly travels on business trips to hospitals in the zone of the Special Military Operation in Ukraine. translation: A pre-trial investigation has been launched into the fact of the explosion in the Bila Tserkva building. On March 30, at 3:02 p.m., medical workers informed the police about the explosion in the five-story building, which was destroyed. As a result of the explosion, the building caught fire from the second to the fifth floors. Rescuers extinguished the flames. Later, from the house, the employees of the State Emergency Service escorted an 8-year-old child, who was hospitalized with poisoning by combustion products, to the ambulance. Unfortunately, during the inspection of the apartments, the bodies of two people were also discovered: the resident of the apartment in which the explosion happened, as well as the body of an elderly woman, who was unblocked from under the rubble on the floor below. Specialist criminologists have recorded traces of a criminal offense. üëÆ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èInvestigators of the Belotserkiv District Police Department have started a pre-trial investigation (Part 2 of Article 270 of the Criminal Code). Currently, law enforcement officers and rescuers are taking the necessary measures to establish the circumstances of the explosion. üëâBila Tserkva - NO TABOO üì©Send an interesting photo/video
description: A Ukrainian Telegram channel primarily focusing on news from Bila Tserkva (literally "White Church"), Kyiv Oblast'. The channel also features posts designed to wear away at Russian morale and raise Ukrainian spirits.

translation:
Forwarded from: Voivode Broadcasts
Is this possible, only sUMPK? Can I get Masha for the buck! Then, may I?
No!

And why?

I'll explain it to you now.

Let's start with the simplest: FAB-5000, like FAB-9000, ultimately did not achieve the declared characteristics. No joke. Part of the explosive remained unattended.
No detonation.

Yes, there is evidence that similar beauties of the hills in Afghanistan were turned into plains.

But, in the current conflict, given the saturation of air defense, they will be useless!

Why?
Dimensions.
The bomb itself, plus the plane that will need to be attached, plus the low speed of gliding towards the target.

A big, simply huge target for any air defense. To put it very simply, a bomb is the size of an airplane.

Carriers. FAB-9000 is generally a minus. There are no more planes that could carry them.

FAB-5000, in theory it‚Äôs possible, but those planes cannot maneuver from air defense after being dropped.

Therefore, we are waiting for FAB-3000 with UMPC, period.

translation: We remember that March 30 marked the 130th anniversary of the birth of Sergei Vladimirovich Ilyushin (1894-1977), the legendary Soviet aircraft designer, three times Hero of Socialist Labor. Since 1935, Ilyushin headed the Experimental Design Bureau of the aircraft plant named after. Menzhinsky (now the S.V. Ilyushin Aviation Complex). Under his leadership, the Il-2, Il-10 attack aircraft, Il-4, Il-28 bombers, Il-12, Il-14, Il-18 passenger aircraft were created. IL-62, as well as a number of experimental and experimental aircraft. https://t.me/veteranrossii_online

translation:
Mass protests are taking place in Israel demanding the resignation of the government of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. According to Israeli media, about 100 thousand people are participating in the rally, which has become the largest since the beginning of the current escalation of the Palestinian-Israeli conflict.

It is reported that the protest action is accompanied by road closures, the lighting of fires and clashes with the police, who use special means to disperse the crowd, including water cannons.

Protesters, including relatives of hostages held in the Gaza Strip, are insisting on a deal with Hamas for their release. Many also demand that Netanyahu resign. Protesters accuse him of not making any deals or compromises due to personal political interests, sacrificing Israelis and prolonging the conflict.

In response, Netanyahu's supporters called the protesters traitors.üìÆSubscribe to LOMOVKA

translation:
Military situation in the Kherson region March 24 - 30 Terrorist shelling of Russian territory by Ukrainian formations continued. On average, the enemy fired 40 artillery shells per day and carried out FPV drone attacks on energy infrastructure facilities, hospitals, public buildings, and cars in Aleshkinsky, Kakhovsky, Golopristansky, Novokakhovsky and other districts. He used rockets for terrorist attacks on populated areas inland from the LBS. Unfortunately, a 6-year-old girl died from shelling by Ukrainian terrorists, and five people were wounded.

In response to the terrorist actions of the Kyiv regime, military personnel of the Dnepr group of troops, army and attack aircraft launched strikes with all types of weapons against concentrations of Ukrainian militants, military equipment, warehouses and positions. In the areas of the villages of Ivanovka, Mikhailovka, Gavrilovka, Tyaginka, the positions of the so-called ‚Äú35th Marine Brigade‚Äù and several ‚Äúterritorial defense brigades‚Äù were hit. In the suburbs of Kherson, a building used to house the terrorist organization ‚ÄúSBU‚Äù was bombed.

Our fighters also successfully smoked out Ukrainian militants from basements in Krynki and hit enemy watercraft on the Dnieper River, thwarting attempts at rotation and delivery of military cargo.

In general, over the course of a week in the zone of responsibility of the Dnepr group of forces, the enemy lost more than 370 militants, two tanks, seven armored combat vehicles, 29 vehicles and 13 field artillery guns, including five American-made 155-mm M-777 howitzers.
Within a week, 18 Ukrainian soldiers and sergeants surrendered.@SALDO_VGA

translation:
Forwarded from: Agency. News
The majority of Russians believed in the Ukrainian version of the terrorist attack at Crocus City Hall. The majority of Russians believe that Ukraine was behind the terrorist attack at Crocus City Hall, according to the results of a survey of the Anglo-Ukrainian sociological project OpenMinds, cited by the Financial Times. Details. Researchers surveyed 652 Russians. According to the results, more than 50% of respondents blamed the Ukrainian leadership for the attack, and only about 27 percent pointed to the Islamic State (IS). Another 6% blamed the ‚Äúcollective West,‚Äù namely the US, UK and NATO.‚ñ™Ô∏èSeveral percent each believe that veterans of the war in Ukraine and the Russian authorities were behind the attack.‚ñ™Ô∏èThe most reliable or completely reliable source of information about the attack is more than 75% The respondents named Vladimir Putin, who after the terrorist attack spoke several times about the role of Ukraine in the attack on the concert hall.‚ñ™Ô∏èYoung people and opponents of the war in Ukraine do not believe in the Ukrainian version, which is being promoted by the authorities. Among opponents of the war, 50% believe that IS was behind the terrorist attack. More than 40% of Russians aged 18 to 30 believe that the attack was organized by this group. The Ukrainian version is supported by just over 30%.‚ñ™Ô∏èExperts have repeatedly pointed out the difficulty of assessing the sincerity of Russians when conducting opinion polls, since people may be afraid to express their real position due to the suppression of dissent in the country. The FT makes a similar reservation when publishing the survey results.‚ñ™Ô∏èOpenMinds previously surveyed Russians about their attitude towards the death of Alexei Navalny, reaction to the death of Yevgeny Prigozhin and perception of the war between Israel and Hamas. Context. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack. This was confirmed by Western intelligence services.‚ñ™Ô∏èIn his first address after the terrorist attack, Putin spoke only about the Ukrainian trace. Later, during a meeting on measures taken after the attack, Putin confirmed that the attack was carried out ‚Äúat the hands of radical Islamists,‚Äù but said that it was beneficial to the ‚Äúneo-Nazi Kyiv regime.‚Äù Subscribe to the Agency

translation:
Morning report as of March 31, 2024. Artemovsk direction: Fighting near Bogdanovka and forest belts north of the village. The assault continues towards Chasov Yar. Donetsk direction: the Russian Armed Forces continue to advance with fighting in Novomikhailovka and expand the zone of control. Active hostilities in the Marinka area. The Russian Armed Forces use military equipment against the Ukrainian Armed Forces at the line Georgievka - Pobeda - Fierce battles in Krasnogorovka and Pervomaisky. In the Tonenkoye area, Russian troops are attempting to advance to the west, fighting in Semyonovka and Berdychi. Avdeevsky direction: Fighting continues along Tsentralnaya and Sadovaya streets in Berdychi. The Ukrainian Armed Forces lost another Abrams tank west of Berdychi. The Russian Armed Forces continue assault operations in the direction of Yasnobrodovka west of Tonenkoye. Zaporozhye direction: Artillery and drone battles are taking place in the Rabotino area. Processing of enemy positions north-west of Verbovoy continues for future assaults. Kherson direction: The situation remains unchanged in Krynki, where the enemy is trying to cross the Dnieper. Artyomovsk direction: Encounter battles in Kleshcheevka and Bogdanovka. The Russian Armed Forces continue to press the enemy‚Äôs defenses in the direction of Chasov Yar.

translation:
The parents wrote a letter of gratitude to the maternity hospital - and this changed the minds of the doctors. In many countries, perinatal palliative care has been developed - for newborns with incurable diseases, as well as for pregnant women who learned about severe fetal pathology. In Russia, only one such program operates so far - in Moscow, at the House with a Lighthouse children's hospice.

Its director, Oksana Popova, told Kommersant special correspondent Olga Allenova what decisions parents make when they learn about an incurable disease in an unborn child, how they can be helped, and why such help is important for society as a whole. Photo: Efim Erichman@kommersant

translation:
Forwarded from: Anastasia Kashevarovaüá∑üá∫
Here's BezsonoviAdmin laughing at Channel One, which talks about psychotropic substances and chips in the hands of the terrorists who killed our people in Crocus. I had a non-contact fight with another lying machine.

It's actually not funny anymore. This is not just nonsense. This is deliberate nonsense to cover up your own gaps.

So, mutual responsibility. Hundreds of thousands of migrants freely enter Russia without any information about their past crimes. Near all migration centers you can buy a certificate of passing the Russian language exam, left registration, etc. It's no secret that this business has been going on for decades. Just like that business with certificates and policies near traffic police departments.

Migrants very often eat nasvay, smoke weed, and maybe even worse. That is, not the psychotropic substances with which the State Department drugged them. And what they have been using since childhood in poor Tajikistan. Where they lived there was a low level of education, a low level of religious education, a low social level and just economic disaster.

Russia, Tajikistan‚Äôs main partner, invests a lot of money in this country. But they are enough for palaces for the elite, and not for the education of people. But even in terms of migration, Russia does not require data on those who enter its territory.

Uneducated people entering, with a criminal past, present and future, with addiction, will be looking for easy money. What chips? What super preparation? It‚Äôs clear that these are just people with low IQs, who are like zombies, with no intelligence or any training. The most dangerous class of savages who are capable of doing terrible things for little money.

We are so good for others, we let everyone in - to our own detriment. Good at the expense of the lives of their citizens. How many people came to Russia during the conflict in Ukraine who work for the SBU? How are youth recruited through games? How do they recruit teenage girls through fake love? How do they mentally pressure the relatives of military personnel and recruit them from the State Intelligence Directorate and the SBU?

We need active work in this direction. Today a woman wrote to me, they sent her a photograph of her husband allegedly in captivity and demanded money on a Sber card. This card has been used by scammers since 2023 and there are reviews about it on the Internet. The bank has not blocked this card.

The security forces physically, with their personnel shortage, cannot fight every story; they need to involve public funds, regional governments, and the media. There is no need to whitewash yourself with stories about chips and a great organization. We need to act. And stop broadcasting this crap from the screens. And play films like Andrei Medvedev‚Äôs on TV about scammers and recruitment.

There is no need to attack those who work for the country, but to connect them and work together. The security forces are aware of the scale of the problems, but officials and great media managers are not. We need to help the security forces.

I‚Äôll tell you more: military commissars go to the public pages of the Ukrainian side for information. They leak information there. Military units recognize people as prisoners of war based on deepfakes.

It's not about the chips. And the fact is that we set ourselves up. We have a lot of offers. We sent them, but it‚Äôs easier to shut our mouths than to actually work. We are not asking for money, we are asking for support. It‚Äôs a shame for the State.TelegramUnofficial BezsonovI don‚Äôt know how to comment on this. Channel One has been amazing lately with its anti-crisis response.@NeoficialniyBeZsonoV0:50Ó¶õVIEW MESSAGE

translation:
Romania will begin issuing Schengen visas to Russians from March 31, Romanian embassy officials said. Applications can be submitted at all country consulates in Russia - in Moscow, St. Petersburg and Rostov-on-Don. Unified visas issued after March 31 will allow Russian citizens enter the Schengen zone for up to 90 days during any 180-day period, the embassy noted.

They also recalled that visas issued until March 31, 2024 can be used for the entire duration of their validity only for entry into Romania, also on the basis of the provisions set out in EU Decision No. 565/2014.

If holders of short-term visas issued before March 31 are planning to visit one of the Schengen countries, they need to apply for a visa to the country of final destination.üìÆSubscribe to LOMOVKA

body:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
Two years have already passed since our warriors, all our people, drove the Russian occupiers out of Kyiv region. Borodyanka, Bucha, Irpin, Hostomel, Moshchun were places of battle, places where Ukrainians fought for their country, for their lives, for their homes free from evil.¬†

Today, we honor the strength of everyone who withstood then, who is fighting now, who is working and who will definitely bring freedom to our entire land, to every city and village of Ukraine that Russia wants to appropriate, but which it will have to give back to Ukrainians. Our people, our spirit, our strength will ensure this.¬†

I thank everyone who helps! I thank everyone who is with Ukraine and in Ukraine! I am grateful to our warriors! I am proud of our people!
Glory to Ukraine!

translation:
Forwarded from: Multinational
Tajik poet Muhammad Azizov wrote a poem about how hard it is for him to live in Russia and how he hates the Russian people (he calls them dogs and yellowheads), but still serves us (the infidels).

‚ÄúI'm tired of the yellow-headed Russian people. I have a mother and wife at home. The mosque was empty in my village. This life in which I serve the infidels. There are so many knowledgeable scientists here with their heads down. How many teachers and mullahs here have lowered their heads. Here a Russian dog is more valuable than a Tajik. Your relatives will become your enemy. Children here do not know their fathers. Here they will not ask each other for help. On the day when you need help.
Find out who is your friend and who is your enemy. I have money in my pocket and my heart is sad. Because my child needs a father. My life was spent in a foreign land. My mother is sick because of my grief. I'm tired of the yellow-headed Russian people. After all the suffering, I don‚Äôt even need money. I want to see my mother's face. I have a wife and children in my homeland.‚Äù Two people who know the language confirmed to us the authenticity of this translation. This poet has 72k followers on Instagram, among many of them these poems found a positive response, hundreds of comments, almost a thousand likes.

We think that we need to set up a telephone line with him and then send him home to stomp on a sweaty lamb and eat crumbly pilaf. Those who comment positively there are a risk group.

translation:
‚òïÔ∏è‚òïÔ∏è‚òïÔ∏èGood morning!

What a strange March we have been given!
He was both gentle and harsh,
And simple-minded and cunning -
And full of snow and winds...

It was March of unfulfilled dreams,
Unnecessary, outdated shackles,
And protracted goodbyes
Which time limit is five minutes...

Frosty March in waist-deep snow,
He lived carelessly, like a child,
Without worrying about the future
And not sad about the past...

David Samoilov. Last day of March. Tomorrow is April. Have a good day!

translation:
Forwarded from: Voivode Broadcasts
Is this possible, only sUMPK? Can I get Masha for the buck? Then, may I?
No.

And why?

I'll explain it to you now.

Let's start with the simplest. FAB-5000, like FAB-9000, ultimately did not achieve the stated characteristics. No joke. Part of the explosive remained unattended.
No detonation.

Yes, there is evidence that similar beauties, hills in Afghanistan were turned into plains.

But, in the current conflict, given the saturation of air defense, they were useless.

Why?
Dimensions.
The bomb itself, plus the plane that will need to be attached, plus the low speed of gliding towards the target.

A big, simply huge target for any air defense. To put it very simply - a bomb the size of an airplane.

Carriers. FAB-9000 is generally a minus. There are no more planes that could be carried.

FAB-5000, in theory it‚Äôs possible, but those planes cannot maneuver from air defense after being dropped.

Therefore, we are waiting for FAB-3000 with UMPC, period.

translation:
Forwarded from: Operational reports
‚ö°Ô∏èThe Russian Aerospace Forces carried out a group strike with high-precision long-range air-based weapons and unmanned aerial vehicles against energy infrastructure facilities and the gas production industry of Ukraine.

As a result of the strike, the work of defense industry enterprises producing and repairing weapons, military equipment and ammunition was disrupted. All strike targets were achieved, the designated objects were hit.

Active hostilities continue in the Donetsk direction, where Russian fighters occupied more advantageous positions and defeated several air assault brigades of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the areas of Krasnogorovka, Chasovoy Yar, Krasny, Bogdanovkn, Kleshcheevkn and Novomikhailovka of the DPR. In this direction, the militants lost over 300 military personnel, two armored combat vehicles, eight cars, two D-20 guns, a D-30 howitzer, a D-44 cannon, a Bukovel-AD electronic warfare station, as well as two warehouses with artillery ammunition.

The situation has also improved in the Avdeevsky direction. In the areas of the settlements of Leninskoye, Tonenkoye, Vodyanoye, Berdychi and Pervomaiskoye DPR, nine counterattacks of enemy assault groups were repelled.

In addition, operational-tactical aviation, missile forces and artillery of groups of troops of the Russian Armed Forces at the Voznesensk airfield in the Nikolaev region destroyed three Su-25 aircraft of the Ukrainian Armed Forces.üéØ@opersvodki

Turkey has begun electing local governors who will serve for five years. Today, March 31, in the General Local Government Elections, voters in 32 provinces began going to the ballot boxes from 07:00 am, while in other provinces the voting process began from 08:00. Voters in big cities [this is a legal term (b√ºy√ºk≈üehir belediyesi) ‚Äì there are 30 of them out of 81] in Istanbul, Ankara, Izmir, Antalya, Adana, Aydin, Balikesir, Bursa, Denizli, Diyarbakir, Erzurum, Eskisehir, Gaziantep, Hatay, Kahramanmaras, Kayseri, Kocaeli, Konya, Malatya, Manisa, Mardin In the provinces ( il), who do not have the status of a large city, will be elected as ‚Äúmembers of the council of il‚Äù, ‚Äúheads of municipalities‚Äù, ‚Äúmembers of the municipal council‚Äù and ‚Äúmukhtars and council of elders‚Äù. In rural areas, voting will be carried out for ‚Äúmembers of the il council‚Äù and ‚Äúmukhtars and the council of elders.‚Äù

Traditionally, fewer people vote in local elections than in presidential and parliamentary elections, but turnout again exceeds 80%. With a population of 85 million, 60 million are eligible to vote. #localelections

A 73-year-old man who was in one of the houses was killed during the enemy attack. His 50-year-old daughter, who was injured in the yard, was taken to a medical facility. The hospital diagnosed the victim with a mine-explosive injury and shrapnel wounds.

On another street, a 70-year-old woman became a victim of the Russian army - she died in her own home.

Among the damaged objects are residential buildings of townspeople and farm buildings.

As Ukraina.ru reminds, the battles for this settlement were long and difficult. We entered the village itself a year and a half ago, and most of it remained under the control of the Russian Armed Forces. But due to the length of the settlement along the highway, its complete liberation depended on the success of the Avdeevka operation.

After Avdeevka came under the control of our troops, the liberation of the villages adjacent to it continued, and today the DPR flag flies over Vodyanoy, writes WarGonzo.@anna_news
